loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badeya  est majoritairement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à N’tomikorobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pâtes d’arachides, vêtement, produits cosmétiques, charbon du bois et du dèguè. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kandia (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des pâtes d’arachides de qualité dans tout quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de grains  d’arachides en gros au marché. Pour faire la pâte d’arachide, on trie les meilleurs grains, les grille, les épluches et les Broie au moulin. La pâte ainsi faite est prête à la vente en détails à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kandia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de maintenir cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir beaucoup plus d’argent.
texts.en:
The group Badeya is composed mostly of monogamous women, who average 34 years of age and two children each, all living in N’tomikorobougou, a district of Bamako. The women know one another through community ties, and they have small-scale businesses involving peanuts, clothing, cosmetic products, charcoal, and dèguè [a millet pudding or porridge]. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Kandia (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling quality peanut butter in any neighborhood. She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 sacks of peanuts wholesale at the market. 

To make peanut butter, the best peanuts are selected, roasted, hulled, and then crushed in a mill. The paste prepared in this way is ready for retail sale to a customer base composed mostly of women.

With this loan, Ms. Kandia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA  that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to maintain this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso in order to have much more money.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: David

texts.es: David vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos David vive en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad David se dedica al transporte publico y necesita dinero para realizar un mantenimiento general de su vehiculo. La pareja de David se dedica a la elaboracion de tucumanas pero no obtiene grandes ganancias por eso David necesita su colaboracion
texts.en: David is in a common-law relationship and has two children. David lives in the city of La Paz in a brick and cement house that he owns. He operates a taxi and needs money to do general maintenance on his vehicle. David's partner makes tucumanas (stuffed pastries), but does not earn a great deal, and that is why David needs your help.

loans.use: To do general maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kolaban est équitablement composé  de  femmes monogames et polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (léger, pagne wax, basins,…) de toutes les qualités et des légumes. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djoncounda (femme assise en 2ème de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax, légers,...). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 pièces de pagne  wax, 80 mètres de légers en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails au Badialan III et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Djoncounda espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Kolaban group is composed equally of monogamous and polygamous wives, who average 36 years of age with an average of two children each. They all live in Badialan III, one of Bamako's districts, and they met as neighbors. The group members have small businesses selling clothing (light fabrics, "pagnes wax", which are colorful and highly decorative pieces of fabric, and damask fabric) of all quality and vegetables. With a view to getting fresh supplies for cash, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Djoncounda, who is sitting second from the left in the photo, has a great reputation for selling clothing ("pagnes wax", light fabrics, etc.). She is planning to use her loan to buy 30 pieces of "pagne wax" and 80 meters of light fabric wholesale at the Grand Market. She resells her products on a retail basis in Badalian III and door to door to a mixed customer base.

Thanks to this loan, Djoncounda hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is, through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, to buy a piece of land for habitation purposes.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Antonio es un joven soltero que labora como maestro de educacion primaria en un colegio publico impartiendo clases a niños de 10 ba 14 años desde hace 3 años, como joven con pènsamiento de superacion a sentido la necesidad de ir comprando sus articulos electrodomesticos para ir mejorando su calidad de vida por eso solicito el credito para la compra de un televisor.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Antonio is a single young man who works as an elementary school teacher. He has been teaching children between the ages of 10 and 14 at a public school for the past three years.

Being a young man who believes in succeeding, he feels that it is necessary to buy a few household appliances so that he can improve his quality of life. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy a television.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gregoria tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 14 años, 8 años y 27 años de edad. Ella es pequeña comerciante quien se dedica a la comercialización de tamales y pescado fresco desde hace 6 años. Gregoria es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y visionaria quien desea mejorar  sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención y para encementar el piso de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y grava.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 59 years old and resides in her own home along with her three children (ages 14, 8, and 27). She is a small businesswoman who has been selling tamales and fresh fish for six years. Gregoria is a hardworking, enterprising, and visionary woman who wants to improve her living conditions. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the construction of a retention wall and lay down a cement floor in her home.

The amount she requested will be used to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a retention wall and to lay down a cement floor in her home.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 35ans, Adjo est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle  revend du jus de citron, bissap, de l'eau minérale à domicile. Elle fait son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des matières premières (bissap, sucre, arôme). Elle espère devenir grossiste et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: Adjo is a 35-year old single woman who has no children in her care. In order to provide for her needs she retails lemon juice, hibiscus juice and mineral water from her home. She is requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy raw materials (hibiscus flowers, sugar, flavorings, etc.). She hopes to become a wholesaler and later on to give married life a try.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and raw materials.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda se dedica al negocio de comercialización de elementos de artesanía variada, la socia elabora, compra y vende elementos de imaginería, prendas de vestir tejida, utilitarios y adornos entre otros y los comercializa en los diferentes mercados artesanales de la ciudad, Hilda realiza esta actividad hace muchos años y esta le representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia, Hilda solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo carteras de cuero y bisutería para capitalizar su comercio.
texts.en: Hilda buys and sells a variety of locally-made products that include knitted clothing pieces and decorative items.  She sells her merchandise in some of the city's many crafts markets.  Hilda started the business several years ago and her earnings from the business are now her family's main source of income.  Hilda is applying for a loan that she will use buy leather purses, costume jewelry and other artisanal products that she will then resell.

loans.use: to stock her retail crafts business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 43 years old and married with ten children. One of the children has not yet started school. Her husband works as a house builder. 

Agnes owns a butcher's shop which she has been running for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more meat to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more cows for meat to sell at her butcher's shop.

loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en:
Marichelle is 33 years old and has two children, who are in school. Marichelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. She has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Cervella

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cervella works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Cervella is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more ginger to sell.

Cervella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ginger to sell for her business

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 49 years old. She is married with four children. 

Vestine sells spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles. She started the business after observing that most people need to repair their rides.  At one point, she once sold foodstuffs.

With the loan, Vestine will buy spare parts to sell.  The profits will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more eggs to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more eggs and fresh milk.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora de 64 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y muy emprendedora a sus 64 años es madre de 2 hijos varones los cuales viven con sus respectivas esposas, ella trabaja en su hogar y cada día se esmera por salir adelante en su diario vivir; ya que a los 25 años quedo viuda y le toco sola salir a flote con sus dos hijos, esto la convirtió en un ejemplo de mujer para sus vecinos y familia.

 Cuando su esposo falleció después de 2 años emigro a USA, para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos luchando constantemente logro su objetivo, terminar de crecer a sus dos hijos y darles educación.  Flora  demuestra que si deseamos algo lo podemos alcanzar nada es imposible si tienes la confianza en Dios y el firme deseo de alcanzar los objetivos. 

Después de regresar de USA, comenzó un proyecto emprendedor con el cual continuo luchando en su país natal El Salvador, vendiendo pan dulce el cual ella misma elabora en su horno de gas y lo vende en el pueblo y también tiene venta de productos medicinales: tales como Vitaminas, Reconstituyentes y Productos Anti-anemicos para el fortalecimiento de la sangre. Esta actividad le da  un sostén para sobrevivir ya que ella es muy independiente y su espíritu luchador no se rinde a pesar de su edad continua luchando como el primer día con su venta de pan dulce y productos medicinales. Manifiesta que no dejara de hacerlo pues su convicción de mujer luchadora no la abandona y sigue con ella hasta el final.     

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar harina, levadura, huevos, azucar, vitaminas, reconstituyentes, etc, para elaborar mas pan y vender mas medicinas y así poder mejorar sus ventas.     

 Flora planea en un futuro con un incremento en su producción de pan dulce e inventarios y mejorar sus ventas y tener un negocio  mas fuerte y así obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flora, 64, is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. She has 2 sons who live with their wives. She works at home and every day strives to get ahead; since she was widowed at the age of 25 and was left alone to raise her 2 children. This has turned her into a role model for her neighbors and family.

When her husband day, she emigrated to the USA, to provide for her 2 children. With hard work, she managed to achieve her goal: to raise her children and provide them with an education. Flora proves that, if we want something, we can achieve it. Nothing is impossible if we have faith in God and a strong wish to achieve our goals.

After returning from the USA, Flora started an entrepreneurial project in her home country, El Salvador, selling sweet bread that she makes in her own gas oven and then sells in town. She also sells medicinal products: vitamins, toners and anti-anemic products to fortify the blood. This activity gives her enough to survive, since she is very independent and her fighting spirit never gives up. Despite her age, she continues fighting like always with her business of sweet bread and medicinal products. She says she will never stop doing this, because her convictions, typical of a strong woman, never abandon her and continue with her until the end. 

She will use the loan to buy flour, yeast, eggs, sugar, vitamins, toners, etc., to make more bread and sell more medicines and improve her sales.

Flora is planning to increase her production of sweet bread and her stock of medicines in the future. She wants to have a stronger business and make a bigger profit, in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, eggs, sugar, vitamins, tonics, etc. to make more bread and sell more medicines and improve her sales.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con su madre, hermana y sobrina. Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a la familia Ella trabaja como empleada publica y necesita credito para pagar examenes medicos generales, pues su salud ha decaido Ya que ella y su hermana comparten los gastos de la casa (la madre es una mujer jubilada), Ana Maria no puede pagar los examenes por su cuenta por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Ana Maria is single, has no children and lives with her mother, sister, and niece. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house which belongs to the family. She is a public employee and needs a loan to pay for general medical tests because her health has been declining. 

Ana Maria and her sister share the household expenses (their mother is retired), and Ana Maria does not have the money to pay for her medical tests herself. This is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests.

loans.name: Tuyangatane Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is aged in her early thirties and has got four children, of whom two are at school. She is single and makes her living by running a mamalishe (local restaurant) business. Zainabu has been in this business for two years now and is able to make a very small profit per month. She works at her business from 6 AM to 10 PM per working day. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy a sack of baking flour and one bucket of cooking oil for her food stall. She dreams that one day she will be able to grow her business and improve her life. 

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group, Tuyangtane, which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a sack of baking flour and one bucket of cooking oil for her food stall.

loans.name: Djenebagroupe

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Djenebagroupe ont en moyenne 48 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes (concombres, laitues et poivrons), condiments, mortiers et restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nionsson (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de légumes, (concombres, laitues et poivrons).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 sacs de concombre, 3 sacs de poivrons et 15 corbeilles de laitues en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Niomirambougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Nionsson compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Djenbagroupe group are married equally in polygamous and monogamous households and average 48 years of age with eight children each. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of Bamako's districts, and got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the market in Niomirambougou. The group members have small businesses selling vegetables (cucumbers, lettuces and peppers), condiments and mortar and restauration activities. With a view to increasing their businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan.

Nionsson, who is sitting on the far right of the photo is a significant seller of vegetables (cucumber, lettuces and peppers). She is planning to use her loan to buy 15 sacks of cucumbers, three sacks of peppers and 15 baskets of lettuce, wholesale in Bamako. She resells her products on a retail basis in Niomirambougou to a customer base made up primarily of women. With this loan Nionsson expects to make an average monthly profit of 80,000FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to provide for small household needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Kadiatougroupe

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Kadiatougroupe ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (macaronis et  piments), pommes de terre,  habits et des céréales. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adjaratou (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (macaronis et  piments). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de macaroni et une corbeille de piment,  au marché. La revente se fait en détail à Niomirambougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Adjaratou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kadiatougroupe group, the majority of whom live in polygamous households, average 36 years of age with five children each. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of Bamako's districts, and got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the market in Niomirambougou. The group members have small businesses selling condiments (macaroni and chili peppers) potatoes, clothing and cereals. With a view to increasing their businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan.

Adjaratou, who is sitting on the far left of the photo is a significant seller of condiments (macaroni and chili peppers). She is planning to use her loan to buy 10 cartons of macaroni and a basket of chili peppers from the market. She resells her products on a retail basis in Niomirambougou to a customer base made up primarily of women. With this loan Adjaratou expects to make an average monthly profit of 45,000FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to provide for small household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yeredèmè est uniquement composé de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de,  produits cosmétiques, des céréales, des légumes  et des habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Coumba (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de pommades et 3 cartons parfums                                                                                                       à Bamako en gros. La revente se fait en détails au Badialan III à une clientèle mixte. Madame Coumba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Yeredèmè group is made up solely of polygamous wives. They average 35 years of age with two children each and all live in Badialan III, one of Bamako's districts. They got to know each other as neighbors. The group members have small businesses selling cosmetics, cereals, vegetables and clothes. With a view to increasing their businesses, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan.

Coumba, who is sitting on the far right of the photo, has a great reputation for selling cosmetics. She is planning to use her loan to buy five cartons of creams and three cartons of perfumes. She resells her products on a retail basis in Badialan III to a mixed customer base. With this loan Coumba expects to make an average monthly profit of 90,000FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is, through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, to buy a plot of land for habitation purposes.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia se dedica al negocio de venta alimentos y bebidas en su restaurante, negocio  con el cual ha podido consolidar su actividad. Celia en esta como en anteriores oportunidades está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, arroz, menestras, verduras y otras cosas mas.
texts.en: Celia sells prepared food and drinks in her restaurant, which is where she focuses her activity. As before, she is requesting this loan so she can buy meat, rice, dried beans, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meat, rice, dried beans, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha se dedica al negocio de venta de  productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes. Bertha realiza estas actividades hace algunos años y estos le representa su principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia, Bertha solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite y  bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en: Bertha sells staple products in her grocery store. She has been doing this for some years and it is the primary source of income for her family. She is asking for the loan so she can buy items such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional banana to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for nine years and earns additional income by operating a general store and by weaving mats.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requesting an additional loan to build her business.

Josephine has sustained her business through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Josephine dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy banana to sell.

loans.name: Blagica

texts.en: Blagica is 42 years old, has two children and lives with her family in one of the minority communities in Kosovo. She is a nurse and her husband works in the post office, but they are also involved in agriculture. They own some land where they plant wheat and corn which they sell and also use to feed their family. This business yields a good profit and additional income, which allows them to save for their children’s futures. Blagica is now in need of a loan in order to purchase a trailer and new tools. By continuing to work hard in her multiple jobs, she hopes to provide better living conditions for her family. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer and new tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install a new water system and electricity, and to purchase kitchen appliances

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris continua con su labor como docente de la educación primaria en una de las escuelas de la ciudad y paralelamente estudia la carrera profesional de contabilidad  en una de las universidades del Cusco, Iris sabe que estudiando y actualizándose podrá procurarse un mejor porvenir y a futuro ofrecer una mejor vida a su familia.  La socia solicita el crédito para pagar su titulación de su carrera profesional de contabilidad.
texts.en: Iris continues to work as a teacher in one of the Primary schools of the city and at the same time study to be a professional Accountant at one of the universities in Cusco. Iris knows that studying and upgrading will help her have a better future and later allow her to provide a better life for her family. Iris is requesting a loan to pay for her courses in Accounting.

loans.use: to pay for her professional Accounting studies.

loans.name: Batsumiya

texts.en: Batsumiya is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and a daughter in their apartment in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Suhbaatar, works at local government organization as a driver. Her daughter, Urtnasan, is 20 and a university student. Batsumiya started her own clothing retail business in 1990. She has been running her business in a rented stall at the local market. She is a hard-working and friendly woman who has built a close relationship with her customers and suppliers. Her siblings work and live in South Korea. Batsumiya is requesting loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of well-designed, high quality clothes inventory from Korea using her network to sell at her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of well-designed, high quality clothes inventory from Korea to sell.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nuestra Señora de la Asunción está en su ciclo número 5° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá por medio de las capacitaciones ir mejorando sus vidas.
Salustiana es una de estas mujeres, ella ese dedica a la venta de frutas variadas y de estación, que vende de manera ambulante, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que lucha por su familia, ya que quiere darles todo lo que no pudieron tener y que de esa forma no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ella comienza su día desde muy tempranas horas, y llega hasta muy tarde.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser manzanas, naranjas, piñas, bananas, y demás frutas lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Nuestra Señora de la Asunción” is in its 5th cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank Program, where everyone works and helps one another to move forward.  They are completing the Elimination of Poverty Survey that enables them to continue improving their lives by providing them with training.

Salustiana is one of these women. She sells various and seasonal fruits on foot. She is a very unselfish woman who fights for her family, as she wants to give them everything that they were not able to have, so that they will not need anything. She starts her day very early and she works very late.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase seasonal fruit such as apples, oranges, pineapples, bananas, and others. This will help her to implement her business plan, which will help her to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase apples, oranges, pineapples, bananas, and other fruits.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, actividad que viene realizando hace muchos años y que representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia. Juana solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, leche etc. para capitalizar su comercio.
texts.en: Juana sell basic food items in her grocery store. She has been doing this for many years and it is the main income and sustenance for her family. Juana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, oil, pasta, milk, etc. to increase the working capital of her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, pasta, milk, etc.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome is single. He owns a bar and has been in the business for the past five years. With the requested loan, he would like to buy more beer and soft drinks to sell. He plans to use the profits to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome is 30 years old. He is married to a businesswoman and they have one child. He owns a restaurant and sells cooked food. They have been in the business for the past ten years. With this loan, he would like to buy more foodstuffs to use in the restaurant as well as making more investments into his business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for use in cooking food for sale

loans.name: Agines

texts.en:
Agines is from Lori region of Armenia. She trades in clothing in a small rented store. Agines's only son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. 
Agines lives alone and works hard to develop her business and gather more income so her son will be able to come back to his family.
The requested loan will be a great support for Agines to purchase new stock of clothing to sell to customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is a cook who works at a local school. Besides her work Hasmik also receives orders from locals and makes different types of cookies. She is very kind and loves the work she does.
Hasmik has requested this loan to be able to invest in her small scale business. The loan will help her to purchase a refrigerator and food supplies needed for making different cookies. She will be very grateful if lenders help her with her business.
Hasmik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator and food supplies needed for making different cookies

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 44 years old. She is married with five children. She sells beer and soda in her own bar, which she has been running for the past seven years. With this loan, she would like to buy more crates of beer for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  fish, meat, rice, palm, oil, vita, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en: Tasleem is a 50-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has expertise in stitching and has been using her skill to provide financial support to her family for over 15 years. She knows the techniques of sewing very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, and laces to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, and laces.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is a 47-year old married woman.  She and her husband sell animals. She buys baby goats & calves at low prices, raises them and then sells them  in the market for a profit. The business earns enough money to contribute to the family's income. 

She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good business contacts. 

With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El joven Juan  tiene 21 años, el tiene su taller de chapería y pintura de vehículos que se encuentra ubicado en la zona Banzer, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el joven Juan  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la ampliación de su taller ya que quiere brindar comodidad a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para el terminado de la construcción,  el joven Juan  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son continuar ampliando su actividad teniendo más clientes en el taller y  va a utilizar los beneficios en ampliar su negocio, el joven Juan  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man who is 21 years of age. He has a paint and body shop where he repairs vehicles. His business is located in the District of Banzer. This loan is his first transaction with Emprender. Juan will use the loan to buy construction materials so that he can expand his repair shop and provide comfortable conditions for his customers. His reason for requesting this loan is because he lacks what is needed to finish construction.

Juan faces challenges in his business, such as continuing to expand his business and dealing with more customers in his shop. He will use his profits to expand his business. Juan is a hardworking individual who is very grateful for the opportunity he has received. His business is his only means of supporting himself.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can expand his repair shop.

loans.name: Eiby Melissa

texts.es:
La señora Eiby de 31  años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos es madre soltera y tiene casa propia, radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la venta de pescado y camarón, sus clientes viene a su casa a comprar el producto por libras y al por mayor, doña Eiby es una mujer trabajadora que ha sacado adelante a su familia negociando con pescado y camarón, es un buen ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación.
Eiby está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de mas productos como ser; pescado para ponerlo a secar ya que viene la semana santa y este producto se escasea y desea tener en existencia para poder atender a sus clientes, con el apoyo del préstamo ella mejorara su negocio y tendrá mejores ganancias porque venderá mas y sus clientes también tendrá más productos que vender, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y Kiva es su sexto préstamo que solicita.
Eiby su sueño es tener otra casa más grande para darle mejor comodidad a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Eiby, 31, is a single mother and has her own house.  She lives with her two children in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras.

She has worked for five years selling fish and shrimp.  Her customers go to her house to buy the product by the pound and wholesale.  Eiby's a hardworking woman who has provided for her family with her fish and shrimp business.  She's a good example of work and dedication.

Eiby's requesting the loan to buy more products, such as fish to dry, because Holy Week is coming up.  This product gets scarce and she wants to have some on hand to take care of her customers.  With the support of the loan she'll improve her business and earn better profits because she'll sell more and her customers will have more products to buy.

She's very happy about continuing to work with Prisma and Kiva.  This is the sixth loan she has requested.

Eiby's dream is to have a bigger house so her family will be more comfortable.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, March 2014

loans.use: to buy fish to dry for Holy Week

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used the loan he received from VisionFund Kenya to buy baking ingredients which helped boost his bakery business.

Peter has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy flour,eggs,and milk to use in his bakery.  He will  increase his source of income. 

He hopes to expand his business  to become a large scale booming confectionery.

loans.use: to buy flour and other bakery items.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 62 years old, married, and supports a family of three children  between the ages of 21 and 15.

Jacinta has run a farm for many years. She has applied for her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy  fertilizer and seedlings.

She hopes to boost her farming business in the near future and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertlizer.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta lives in Yerevan. She rents a small garage in the center of the town where she provides grinding service. Three years ago Marieta leased equipment needed for providing grinding service. 

She has requested this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of supplies which she needs for providing grinding service to her customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of supplies for providing grinding service

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is a 27-year-old married woman. She sells cloth in her local area. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Elena de 19 años de edad, estudio hasta  8° grado debido a que se acompaño tuvo que dejar la escuela. Esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un niño de 2 años y nadie mas vive con ellos.

 Elena comenta que ella para ayudar a su esposo tiene una crianza de gallinas y cerdos, y como están iniciando su hogar se va con su esposo a trabajar en la milpa con él. Siembran pipían, ejote y maíz, y ella se encarga de comercializarlo. Su día comienza a las 5:00 am. Se levanta a preparar el desayuno luego lleva su niño donde su mamá, para que lo cuide mientras ella le ayuda a su esposo. Trabaja 5 horas y regresa para ir a traer a su niño, y pasar con él,  el resto del día, pero todo lo hace con mucho entusiasmo porque su deseo es que no falte nada en su hogar.


El crédito sera invertido para comprar semilla, abono y herbicidas para la siembra de maíz, pipían, ejote.

Sueña con seguir estudiando y lograr tener un trabajo en una empresa, tener su propia vivienda ya que hoy vive en casa de un amigo, pagar el préstamo y que su hijo se prepare en una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Elena is 19 years old and studied up to Grade 8. She had to leave school when she got married, Her husband is a farmer and they have a two year old son. No one else lives with them.

Elena comments that she raises chickens and pigs in order to help her husband. As they are just staring their household she goes out to work the corn with him. They grow squash, green beans and corn and she takes care of the selling.

Her day begins at 5 am when she gets up to make breakfast. Then she takes the child to her mother, who takes care of him while she helps her husband. She works 5 hours and then goes and gets her child and spends the rest of the day with him. She does all this with enthusiasm because she wants her household to lack nothing.

The loan will be invested in buying seed, herbicide, fertilizer to grow corn, squash and green beans. She dreams of continuing her studies and then working in a business. She also wants her own house as today they live in the house of a friend. She wants to pay off the loan and see her child prepare for university studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and herbicide to plant corn, squash and green beans.

loans.name: Shumila

texts.en:
Shumila is a 32-year-old married woman. She has sold material for  three years. She buys material of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She requests 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of material in different colors and designs for the summer season to attract more customers and expand her inventory. It will help her increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs for the summer season.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 46-year-old  married woman with 5 children. The man shown in the photo is Irshad’s son.  He is a professional driver  and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has driven a rickshaw for many years in order to meet the family expenses.   THe rickshaw is in need of proper maintenance.

For this reason, Irshad has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires and spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Irshad is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare auto parts.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida, age 41, is a married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for the past seven years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy packs of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 52-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking lady who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Afzala

texts.en:
Afzala is a 50-year-old married woman. She has had a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials.  She has become very famous for providing the best services.

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she wants to buy a variety of cosmetic products.  For this reason she applied for 40,000 PKR to buy bulk quantities of hair and skin care products.

She hopes to cater to more customers.  This is her 4th loan cycle and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy hair and skin care products.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. The man shown in the photo is Shagufta’s husband.  He is a professional driver and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has driven a rickshaw for many years in order to meet the family expenses.  The rickshaw requires maintenance to keep it  functional. 

For this reason, Shagufta has applied for 40,000 PKR for her husband to buy new tires and spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation service to his passengers. 

Shagufta is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare auto parts.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: La sra. Mayra es madre de 2 hijos los cuales a sabido darle educacion de calidad con sus pocos recursos que obtiene como trabajadora del sector salud donde se desempeña como estadigrafa desde hace 7 años, debido a bajo salario la sra. Mayra siempre a buscado como obtener otros ingresos por lo que los fines de semana se dedica a hacer comida y ofrecerlas a sus vecinos y clientes, sinembargo actualmente cuenta con un poco de dinero por lo que solicito este credito para incrementar sus ventas y por consiguiente obtener mas ingresos para el bien de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra is a mother with two children. She has been able to provide a quality education for her children with what little that she earns working in the health sector. Mayra has worked as a statistician for the past seven years and earns a low salary. She is always looking for ways to earn extra income. For this reason, she prepares food on the weekends and offers it to her neighbors and customers.

Mayra has very little money at the moment, so she is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales and continue earning more money for the benefit of herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her weekend food business.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Sra. Lilian  de 26 años de edad soltera  y madre de 1 hijo, la Sra. Lilian   es una mujer muy emprendedora que gracias  a sus esfuerzos ah sabido superarse, la Sra. Lilian   tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa a pedido, el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar ropa tanto para damas como para caballeros  y así generar ingresos  para su posterior venta y a si también poder tener más ingresos económicos y poder apoyar la educación de su hijo. La Sra. Lilian  es la segunda de la mano derecha  se le distingue por su polo de color gris , la vez  se encuentra muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada, se despide con un fuerte abraso Kiva, sabiendo que cumplirá todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Lilian, 26, is single and has a child. She is an enterprising woman and thanks to her efforts, she has been able to get ahead. Lilian has a small business; she sells clothes on demand, which is her and her family’s only source of income.

She will use this loan to buy clothes for women and for men. She will sell them and receive an income. She will also earn more and will be able to pay for his child’s education.

Lilian is standing second from right to left. She is wearing a gray t-shirt. She appreciates the help she is receiving and says good-bye with a big hug. She knows she will achieve all her goals.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eda Estela

texts.es:
La señora  Eda Estela  de 63  años  de edad es madre soltera ,vive con un  nieto en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 12  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en su negocio ubicado en la comunidad del alto verde,   san Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, en su negocio ella vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, ella vende de todo para el consumo básico y gracias a su actividad ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora mantiene una nieta, es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación con mucho esfuerzo a logrado hacer una  casa que es donde ella vive.
Doña Eda esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de pollo, dulces, churros, refrescos, granos básicos,  carnes, lácteos y otros productos de consumo basico, con el apoyo del préstamo ella pretende, mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante, está muy contenta de poder trabajar  con prisma y kiva,  es su segundo crédito que solicita.
Doña Eda su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.
San Lorenzo, honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
The lady Eda Estela is 63 years old and is a single mother. She lives with a grandchild in her house. For 12 years she has made a living through the selling of groceries. Her business is located in the community of Alto Verde, San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. In her business she sells everything related to the family shopping basket. 

Eda Estela is a hardworking woman and very entrepreneurial, with wishes to get ahead. She sells everything for basic consumption and thanks to her work, she has been able to move her children forward and now takes care of a granddaughter. She is an example of work and dedication. With much effort she has been able to make a home where she lives. 

Doña Eda is requesting the loan to buy chicken, sweets, churros, soft drinks, basic grains, meats, milk products and other basic staple products for her business. With the support of the loan she hopes to improve her income and get ahead. She is very pleased to be able to work with Prisma and Kiva. This is her second loan that she is requesting. Doña Eda's dream is to improve her business and her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2014.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sweets, churros, soft drinks, basic grains, meats, milk products and other products for basic staples for her business.

loans.name: Clery Jorge

texts.es: El joven Clery tiene 26 años,  estudia la carrera  de Bioquímica y Farmacia en una de las universidades reconocidas  de  la Ciudad de La Paz,  trabaja para pagar sus estudios El joven Clery es promotor de productos de belleza de una empresa a nivel internacional,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y  el joven Clery va a usar este préstamo para  el pago de sus mensualidades,  Clery enfrenta retos en su estudios que son Su trabajo no le permite dedicarse completamente a sus  estudio, pero el joven tiene ganas de continuar y seguir adelante, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es Quiere ejercer su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y con el tiempo poder tener una especialidad en su área como también tener una cadena de farmacias.
texts.en:
Clery is a young man of 26 years. He is studying in a Biochemistry and Pharmacology degree program in one of the well-known universities of the city of La Paz. He is working to pay for his education; he is a sales representative for an international beauty products company. 

This is his first loan with the institution, and Clery is going to use it to pay for his monthly tuition payment. He faces challenges in his education; his work does not allow him to dedicate himself completely to his studies, but this young man has the desire to continue and succeed. 

Clery's wish upon finishing his education is to practice his profession, to improve his quality of life and that of his family, and with time, to have a specialty in his field, as well as to own a chain of pharmacies.

loans.use: to pay monthly tuition

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace used a previous loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, a heifer and  pay for labor costs.

Grace has applied for another loan  to buy a dairy cow which will help her with milk production. She is optimistic that her business will do well.

She hopes to enlarge her herd and increase her milk sales.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, a heifer, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella despues de atender a sus hijos que se dedica a ayudar a su esposo en su trabajo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para los gastos de la casa como pagar el agua y energía eléctrica.
texts.en: Marina is a hardworking woman who provides for her family. After assisting her children she works helping her husband in his job. This time she needs a loan to pay for household expenses such as water and electricity.

loans.use: to pay for household expenses such as water and electricity.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es: Luciana se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, papa y otras cosas mas. Luciana se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Luciana sells grilled meat skewers as a street vendor.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as meat, potatoes, and other items.  Luciana is pleased with the support she has received and promises to handle her loan payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a 52-year-old married woman. She  sells cloth in her local area.  She buys  different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She requests 50,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy bulk quantities of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members. 

She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 16 años y 12 años de edad. María se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. María desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda y para encementar el piso de la misma. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband and their two children, ages 16 and 12. She has been making clothes for quite some time. María is a hardworking woman who does everything within her power to provide better living conditions for her family. Since she wants to improve her living conditions, María has requested a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in repairs to the roof of her home and will also lay down a cement floor.

The amount she is requesting will be used to buy galvanized sheets, wood, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair the roof of her house and to lay down a cement floor.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María tiene 59 años de edad y es una mujer admirable que hace todo lo que este en sus manos para ofrecer mejores condiciones a su familia. María habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, hijo de 18 años, y tres hijas (16 años, 13 años y 21 años. María desea reparar el techo del corredor de su humilde vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: María tiene 59 años de edad y es una mujer admirable que hace todo lo que este en sus manos para ofrecer mejores condiciones a su familia. María habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, hijo de 18 años, y tres hijas (16 años, 13 años y 21 años. María desea reparar el techo del corredor de su humilde vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 26-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of two young sons. Isam works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Isam would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.
 
Isam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Isam will be able to provide hot water using a clean power source instead of electricity.

Isam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 29-year-old married man from Deir Al-Balah city. He is a father of two young children, a son and a daughter. Ashraf works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ashraf would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.
 
Ashraf  took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Ashraf will be able to provide hot water using a clean power source instead of electricity.

Ashraf appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cables, a circuit board, breakers and lamps, and pay for the labor required to fix the electrical system of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 25 years old from Nyandarua South. He is married and they don't yet have a child.

Paul has a transport business that he has been running for the past one year. He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy spare parts for his Nissan and also to buy a cow.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future and improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old from Naivasha. She is married and is supporting two children aged 7 years and 3 years old.

Esther has a school which she has been running for several years now. She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy building materials which will be used to build a class and hence expand the school further.

Esther hopes to add more classes and in the end make her school even bigger in the near future.

loans.use: to build a school.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: Yesica se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, colonias, aretes, anillos, ropa y otras cosas mas, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Los Diamantes" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como perfumes. Yesica se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Yesica sells cosmetics such as perfumes, cologne, earrings, rings, clothes and some other products. She is a member of the communal bank “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds], from Asociación Arariwa.

This time, she is requesting a loan to buy items such as perfumes. Yesica appreciates the help she is receiving and promises to pay the installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy items such as perfumes.

loans.name: Rosaura Ines

texts.es:
Rosaura de 34 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta sexto grado de educación. Esta soltera, en un tiempo estuvo casada con quien procreó 3 hijos,  los cuales aún estudian y viven con ella. En casa del cliente viven 5 personas sus tres hijos y la madre de ella. 

Rosaura se dedica a la agricultura,  se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 20 años y aprendió la actividad  de sus padres quienes desde muy pequeña le enseñaron a sembrar los granos básicos, maíz, frijol, entre otros cultivos propios de la agricultura, también tiene como actividad económica la venta de leche y queso en su misma comunidad le proveen esa actividad 3 vaquillas que en temporadas le generan leche y trabajo; en la actividad de la agricultura se involucra el hijo mayor, el horario de trabajo es de 6 horas díarias. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaquilla,  para que le genere más insumo para el negocio al que se dedica, que es la venta de leche y queso.  Además, comprara insumos agrícolas  para el cultivo agrícola, como abono, semilla y fertilizantes.

Los sueños de Rosaura con su negocio es seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y tener un negocio propio. Con sus hijos desea que ellos  estudien y saquen una carrera universitaria, espera para el futuro de sus hijos que sean personas de bien que sirvan a la sociedad. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y su actividad económica, esto le generara más ingreso y podrá satisfacer las necesidades principales de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 34 years old and has a sixth grade education.  She is single but was married at one time and has three children who live with her and attend school.  Five people live in the home, including her three children and her mother.

Rosaura is a farmer and she has been doing this for 20 years.  She learned this from her parents who taught her to plant basic grains, corn, beans, and other things.  She also sells milk and cheese in her community.  She has three cows that produce milk and work. Her oldest son helps with this and they work six hours a day.

She is asking for this loan to buy a cow so that it can provide her more milk and ingredients for cheese.  She will also buy farming supplies such as compost, seeds, and fertilizer.

Rosaura’s dreams are to continue working in what she enjoys and have a business of her own.  She wants her children to continue to attend school and study at university.  She hopes that they will become persons of means and be helpful to society.  This loan will help her improve her business, increase her income, and satisfy her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lorena Esmeralda

texts.es:
Lorena de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta 7° grado debido a las condiciones económicas, dejo de estudiar y luego se acompaño. Es madre soltera de dos hijos de 23 y 22 años de edad, su compañero la abandono  cuando sus hijos estaban pequeños y le ha tocado sacarlos adelante sola. Uno ya esta acompañado y solo uno vive con ella.

 Lorena se dedica al negocio desde que tiene 10° años, con su mama aprendió el oficio pues ella siempre se ha dedicado al negocio. Ella tiene una venta de pupusas, panes y frescos. Como vive en el centro del cantón en su casa tiene el negocio. Ella comenta que se levanta a las 5:30 am  para hacer los quehaceres del hogar porque como a las 8:00 am comienza su jornada y que algunos días llega hasta las 7:00 pm y dice que lo hace siempre soñando en comprarle un terreno a su hijo, esa es su vida diaria. 

El crédito sera invertido en la compra de una docena de laminas, madera y mano de obra, para reparar el techo de su casa.

Su deseo es comprar un terreno para dejarles donde construyan su casa sus hijos, ya que hoy viven en terrenos de su mamá, Construir un cafetín, Construir una casa de ladrillos y pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena is 37 years old and studied only to the 7th grade. Due to her economic conditions, she halted her studies and, later, became attached to a companion. She is a single mother with 2 sons, aged 23 and 22. Her companion abandoned her while her children were small and Lorena has had to raise them alone. One son is already attached and Lorena now lives with just one.

Lorena has had a business for the last 10 years. She learned to operate it from her mother and, since then, she has continued to do so. Lorena sells 'pupusas,' a popular Salvadoran snack, plus bread and soft drinks. She lives in the center of the canton, and operates her business from her house. According to Lorena, she rises at 5:30 am to take care of her housework, then at 8:00 am her work day begins. Some days, she works until 7:00 pm. She does that because she wishes to buy some land for her son. This is her daily life.

Lorena's desire is to purchase land for her sons so they can construct their house. At present, they live on their mother's land. She also wishes to construct a small cafe and a brick house, and pay off her loan with the earnings from her business.

loans.use: to buy a dozen sheets of laminated roofing and wood, plus pay for workers to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en: Rifat is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business selling vegetables for the past 14 years. She is a very enthusiastic lady and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of four children. She is responsible for their food, health and education and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement for her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions and garlic. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions and garlic.

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.es:
José de 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pues la pobreza en la que vivían  le toco que abandonar la escuela para dedicarse a trabajar y ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Esta casado y su esposa se dedica al cuidado del hogar y le ayuda en el cultivo que siembra. Tiene dos hijos y ya salieron del bachillerato y viven con ellos.

José comenta que desde que tiene 13° años aprendió hacer pan, con unos tíos aprendió el oficio y desde entonces no ha dejado de hacer pan, también se dedica a la agricultura y eso lo aprendió con su padre, dice que algo que recuerda de su padre es que siempre le inculco que aprendiera a trabajar para que le fuera bien en la vida, y gracias a Dios a sacado a su familia adelante, menciona que su día comienza muy temprano, se levanta a las 3:30 am porque tiene que caminar 35 minutos para llegar donde trabaja pues tiene que comenzar a las 4:30 am sus labores y termina su día de trabajo a las 2:30 pm, por la tarde se dedica a la agricultura. Así es su vida diaria.


El crédito sera invertido una parte para surtir una pequeña tienda que tienen sus hijos y la otra parte para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. En la tienda comprara granos básicos ( maíz, frijol, maicillo, arroz y mas)

Su propósito es contar con  una tienda grande para sus hijos, con la ganancia pagar el crédito y comprarles un terreno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, 48 years old, did not have an opportunity to study because of the poverty in which they lived. He had to abandon school and start working to help with household expenses. He is married and his wife takes care of the house and helps him in cultivating what he grows. He has two children who finished high school and live with them. Jose explains that since he was 13 years old he learned with some uncle and aunt how to make bread. Since then he has not stopped making bread. He also works in agriculture and this he learned from his father. He says that something he remembers from his father is that he always instilled in him to learn how to work so that he would do well in life, and thanks to God he has been able to provide for his family. He mentions that his day starts very early: he gets up at 3:30 a.m. because he has to walk for 35 minutes to arrive where he works since he needs to start at 4:30 a.m. with his work; and he finishes his workday at 2:30 pm. In the afternoon he works in agriculture. Such is his daily life.
He will invest part of his loan to stock a small store that his children have and the other part to grow 7,000 square meters of corn. In the store he will buy basic grains (corn, bean, sorghum, rice and more)  His goal is to have a big store for his children, and with the earnings to pay the loan and buy a plot of land for his children.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sorghum, rice and more for his children's store, and the other part to grow 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Iqbal is a 47-year-old vigorous, married lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread, cloth and laces. It will allow her to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, cloth and laces.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en: Mukhtar is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. At present, she has 3 cows, 2 buffaloes and 2 goats, which she uses for milk. She sells to the people of her locality. Mukhtar has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Mukhtar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 43-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 8th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en: Neelam is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 3 years with her son (also shown in the photo). She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar, grains and pulses from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, grains and pulses.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en: Shagufta is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has had a business of ‘waan’ manufacturing which is a threadlike material used in making a bedstead on a wooden frame on four legs. She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors and has become famous for providing good quality material in her community. Shagufta operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. They are contentedly doing it for the sake of family. It’s her 7th year with Kashf Foundation. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy another machine to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy another machine.

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad,  es una persona casada que estudio hasta noveno, vive junto a su esposa e hijos. se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana.

 José junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres; para llegar a la parcelas camina 5  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca que  le ayudara en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta.

José planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de leche, podrá comprar más animales.
texts.en:
José is 46-years old.  He is married and went to school until 9th grade.  He lives with his wife and children.  José and his wife, who helps him with his work in the mornings, get up at 5:30a.m.

José and his wife make their living in agriculture, which they learned from their parents.  They walk 5 km. to get to their plots of land.  They work during the morning and then his wife spends her time doing the household chores. 

The loan they are requesting is for the purchase of a cow.  The cow will help them, in the future, to increase their milk production and sales. 

José's plan is that with the income he will receive from the milk sales, he will be able to purchase more livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es: La Sra. Paola tiene 25 años, casada con un hijo de la edad de  4 años,   ella se dedica al servicio de estilismo ella ofrece sus servicios a domicilio,  solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales y productos de belleza para realizar su trabajo ya que tiene mucha clientela, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Paola is 25 years old, married, and has a four-year-old child. She is a stylist and visits her customers at their homes. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies and beauty products. She has many customers, so this loan is important in order to increase her working capital. This will help her to improve her family’s living conditions. She appreciates the help provided by the institution, since this is the only activity she has to maintain her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and beauty products.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and has been running a general store and a hotel for the past six years. He supports his parents, wife, and one child through his business. He currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 40,000.

He would like a loan of KES 100,000 through which he will add bulk stock of flour, rice, sugar, and cooking oil.
