John anticipates that through the expected profits, he will educate his child to higher levels and expand his businesses. In the future, he has hopes and dreams of opening a wholesale general store and renovating his rental houses.

loans.use: to buy stock like rice, flour, and sugar in bulk for his general store

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Rosa es una mujer trabajadora de 37 años de edad, casada y propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, gaseosas, jugos, bolsas, alka seltzer, sal andrew, ranitidina, etc. Con este crédito la socia lograra surtir la pulpería y así aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is a hardworking 37 year old woman.  She is married and has a grocery store in her home and is asking for this loan to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken, soft drinks, juices, bags, alka seltzer, seasoned salt, Ranitidina, etc.  She plans to stock her store and increase her earnings with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida, age 29, is a married woman. She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán  de 25 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad Administración de negocios internacionales  que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida, este es su último año. Hernán   tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen administrador. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Hernán   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en:
Hernán is 25 years old, single, and has no children. He is a likeable student who is majoring in International Business Administration. Hernán is studying hard so that he can accomplish his goals in life. Last year he set a goal of finishing his studies successfully so that he can become a good manager.

The loan he is receiving will be invested in the payment of his university room and board. He will also buy study materials that he needs. Hernán is very grateful for the help that has been offered. He bids farewell by expressing his greatest wish of accomplishing the goals that he has set for himself, thanks to the support from EDAPROSPO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy studies materials and to pay for his university room and board.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad continua dedicándose a la docencia de educación inicial, y paralelamente continua elaborando prendas de vestir, tejidas en lana como bufandas, guantes, gorros, chompas y otras cosas mas. Los distribuye de forma directa y a solicitud de sus clientes. Soledad realiza estas actividades hace algunos años y estos le representa su principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia, Soledad solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lanas de oveja, alpaca, hilos y accesorios para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Soledad is continuing to work as a pre-school teacher, and at the same time continues making wool knitted clothing such as scarves, gloves, hats, sweaters and other things. She distributes them directly based on customer requests. Soledad has been doing this work for some years, and it represents her main source of income for supporting her family.

Soledad is requesting a loan in order to buy material such as sheep and alpaca wool, thread and accessories for making her clothing.

loans.use: To buy materials such as sheep and alpaca wool, thread, and accessories for making her clothing.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old from Nyandarua South. She is married and supporting a family of five children whose ages are between 18 years and 10 years old.

Irene is a farmer and has been in it for many years. She has applied for her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in her farm. Irene will use the profits to pay the loan and expand her farming business.

She hopes to expand her farming business in the near future and uplift her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 30 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. They have two children who are aged 13 and 6 years old. Hellen's spouse is a mason.

Hellen is a farmer and has been doing this for many years. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizers to use in her farm.

She hopes to expand her farming into a large scale in the future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for higher education

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a cyber cafe and a dry cleaning service, which she has been doing for 12 years. She currently earns an estimated monthly income of 110,600 KES.

Deborah requested a loan for 100,000 KES, which she will use to purchase equipment such as a lamination machine and service computers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as a  lamination machine and service computers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 49 years old, married, and has nine children.  Her husband is a house builder.  She is a business woman operating a mini supermarket, which she has been doing for 12 years.  

Florence requested a loan, which she will use to purchase milk, juice, fruits, and other goods to sell  in her supermarket. With the profits from the business, she expects to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, juice, fruits, and other goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, plantain, banana, oil, kola, orange, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Verediane

texts.en: Verediane is 43 years old. She is married to a farmer, and they both have four children. She sells local juices. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to make more local juices for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for making local juices for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, palm oil, salt, onions, vita, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es:
Claribel de 60 años de edad, es una persona que  estudio hasta quinto grado y es una persona soltera. 
se levanta a las 4:30 a.m para realizar sus actividades diarias.


Claribel trabaja en la parcela camina 3 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde ella se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para elaborar queso y venderlo entre sus vecinos
 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar tres vacas y podrá producir mas leche para la elaboración de queso y así incrementar sus ingresos para su sustento

Claribel planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la elaboración de queso, podrá comprar en un futuro un terreno donde pastar sus animales
texts.en:
Claribel is 60 years old, single, and studied through the fifth grade in school.  She gets up every morning at 4:30am to complete her daily tasks. 

She works a parcel of land 3 kilometers walking distance from her home.  In the afternoon she works milking cows and making cheese to sell to her neighbors.  

The loan that she is requesting from Kiva partner CREDICAMPO will be used to buy three cows and it will allow her to produce more milk for making cheese and thus increase her income for living expenses.  

Claribel plans that with the income she will earn from making cheese, she will buy a plot of land for grazing her animals.

loans.use: To purchase 3 cows.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time she attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva, she purchased a cow to increase her sales. Now she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Shaffqat

texts.en:
Shaffqat is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband for the past five years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Shaffqat wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains and beverages.

loans.name: José Israel

texts.es:
José de 71 años de edad, es una persona casada que estudio hasta sexto,  vive junto a su esposa.  Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposa  que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas. El terreno donde cultivan esta a 5  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas que le ayudara en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.

 José planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la  venta de leche, podrá comprar un terreno donde tener sus animales.
texts.en:
José, 71, is married and went to school through the sixth grade.  He lives with his wife.  He gets up at 4:30AM along with his wife, who supports him in his agricultural business.  The land they work is 5K away and José works during the morning while his wife does household chores.

The loan José is seeking is to buy two cows that in the future will help him increase production of milk to sell and bring in additional income for his family.

José plans to use the income he gets from selling milk to buy a plot of land where he can keep his animals.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Livana   de 38 años de edad casada  y madre de  4 hijos, ella se dedica hace 14 años  a la venta de comida tanto en el día como en la noche en su casa.  La Sra. Livana  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su comida y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en  ampliar su casa y comprar sillas, mesas etc. Y poder dar una buena atención al cliente, y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Livana  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva,la Sra. Livana  es la cuarta persona de la mano derecha se le distingue por su polo de color negro, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas
texts.en:
Livana is 38 years old, married and the mother of four children. For 14 years she has been selling food from her home, both during the day and in the evening. Livana says that she has succeeded in gaining loyal customers, which has generated earnings for her so that she can cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to have a shop where she can sell her food and obtain better income. 

She will use the loan granted to enlarge her home and buy chairs, tables, etc. This way she will be able to better serve her customers and be able to get ahead in life.

At the same time, Livana and all of the members are grateful to Kiva. Livana is the fourth person from the right and can be seen wearing her black T-shirt.

She says goodbye with the promise that she will fulfill all the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Emely Jasmin

texts.es:
La joven Emily Jazmín de 20  años de edad es casada, vive con su esposo , tiene un negocio de pulpería en el que venden granos básicos, frescos, churros, detergentes, lácteos, jugos, pollo, verduras, carnes y otros, Ella radica en una colonia  de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras. Se dedica desde hace 01 año a esta actividad.
Emely está solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para compra de arroz, manteca, frescos, carnes, pollo, queso, manteca, carnes, verduras y otros productos para su pulperia  con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende surtir mas su negocio y de esa forma tener mejores ganancias, es su primer préstamo que solicita y tiene muchas expectativas para su negocio.
Emely su sueño es mejorar  su negocio y construir su casa ya que actualmente alquila.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Young Emily Jazmín is twenty-years-old, married, and lives with her husband.  She has a grocery store where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, churros, detergents, dairy products, juices, chicken, vegetables, meat, and other items.  She lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.  She's been in business for a year.  

Emily is seeking 5,000HNL to buy rice, butter, soft drinks, meat, chicken, cheese, vegetables, and other products for her grocery store.  With support from the loan she intends to stock up the store further so she can make more profit.  This is the first loan she has sought and she has high hopes for her business.  

Emily's dream is to improve her business and build herself a house because she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy rice, butter, soft drinks, meat, chicken, cheese, vegetables, and other products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Cleofe Eufemia

texts.es: Cleofe se dedica a la ayudar a su esposo en la carpintería principalmente en la fabricación de ataúdes, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera, pintura, pegamento y otras cosas mas. Cleofe se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Cleofe helps her husband with his carpentry business. The main products that he produces are caskets. She is requesting a loan in order to buy materials such as wood, paint, glue, and other supplies.

Cleofe is pleased with the support that has been provided and promises to handle her loan payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, glue, and other supplies for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 36 years old from Nyandarua South. He is married and supporting four children who are aged between 12 years and 6 years old.

Henry has a general shop that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy sugar, oil, salt, flour, etc. to add to his stock. 

He hopes to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a Barangay Councilor of his barangay (neighborhood) and married to a housewife with six children. Ruben is 54 years old and lives in Barangay Minsubong, Tangub City.

To earn a living, Ruben has had a business of buying and selling bananas for five years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 10,000.00. Ruben has been a member of PMPC for three years and took several loans already. Now, he applied another loan to buy more bananas to sell.

In the future, with his extra income, he wishes to send all his children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She operates a posho mill, which she has been doing for two years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Caren requested her fifth loan for 100,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more cereals, such as maize, for milling. She will use her expected profits she to repay for her loan. In the future, she will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cereals for milling

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 62 years old and lives in Lower Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married and blessed with 3 children. Benedicta has experienced some hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself helping her husband in gardening, and they plant vegetables, flowers and ornamental shrubs.
 
In need of additional working capital, Benedicta decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and has recently requested PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs for land cultivation.

Benedicta has been able to manage her income and to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to raise the necessary working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs for land cultivation

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 62 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with children now at their adult age. 
Alejandra is presently working as a baby sitter and earning approximately PHP3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing medicine for her medication.  Alejandra has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, Alejandra hopes to engage in business.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for her medication

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene has been running a general store business for nine years and earns well to sustain their living. She and her husband have two children and live in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. With her generated income, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid.

Recently, Arlene took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods and bottled products to sell in order to improve sales.

Arlene plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve and expand her business. In this photo, it is during her first loan where she invested her previous loan used in purchasing canned goods and bottled products. She is now hoping to improve her business to ensure a better income. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and bottled products to sell

loans.name: Petero

texts.en:
Petero, a father of 8, has been practicing agriculture for the last 40 years! He hails from the land of Kenyan marathon runners, Eldoret. He sells milk, eggs and maize in the local market. He also offers transportation services to his neighbours using his motorcycle at an agreed price. Petero enjoys horticulture. He is always so eager to learn that he feels lack of adequate knowledge and skills is his major challenge. 

Recently, Petero and a group of farmers from his area were trained in poultry farming. Most farmers kept poultry for subsistence. After the training, they realized poultry is no small business. He saw a lot of potential in this sector. However, he lacked the capital needed to seize this opportunity immediately. 
 
Petero is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will provide an additional stream of income. The extra money will be used to meet the high family expenses. All Petero ever wants is to provide a better life for his children than the life he went through.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Javier Eliecer

texts.es: Javier, hombre de 39 años, es un comerciante que vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 pequeños hijos en las edades de 8 a 12 años. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, como calzado colegial, chancletas  y sandalias deportivas, además de dulces y otros artículos, a solicitud de sus clientes. Su idea emprendedora inició cuando al consultarle a su cónyuge, estuvieron de acuerdo en buscar alternativas generadoras de nuevos ingresos para beneficiar su hogar. Así fue como decididos, aplicaron sus ahorros y créditos a la compra de productos variados y alquilaron un local para exhibirlos,  hoy en día con resultados económicos positivos, pues estuvieron atentos a lograr una buena ubicación de su local y a prestar un buen servicio, satisfaciendo las necesidades de su clientela. En la actualidad Sus ventas las realiza de contado todos los días, desde las 9:30 hasta las 9 de la noche trabajando sin cesar.   Anteriormente hizo su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que le sirvió para ampliar y surtir su negocio de mercancía de mayor rotación lo que impactó sus ventas; Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante Kiva, con el cual comprará  calzado, bolsos, sandalias, aprovechando la temporada que se acerca de gran dinámica en las ventas. Su meta mas adelante es comprar una  vivienda y su mayor desafío es lograr tener los ahorros suficientes para hacer efectivas sus metas, para lo cual planea ampliar su cobertura de clientes para vender muchos mas artículos y con ello  lograr poco a poco sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Javier is a 39-year-old man who lives with his spouse and his three small children, ages 8 to 12. He has been selling various kinds of merchandise for two years, such as school shoes, flip flops, and sport sandals, as well as sweets and other items that his customers request. 
 
His idea for this enterprise began when he consulted with his wife, and they agreed that they should look for other ways to generate new income for their home. So, they decided to use their savings and loans to purchase various products, and they rented a store to display them.  Today, their economic results are positive because they were careful to choose a good location for their store, and to give good service, satisfying their customers’ needs. Currently they conduct cash sales, working every day without stopping, from 9:30 in the morning until 9:00 at night.

Previously, he took his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which helped him to expand and stock his store with merchandise with a higher turnover rate, which impacted his sales; and today he is applying for a new loan with Kiva, with which he will purchase footwear, handbags, and sandals, in order to make the most of the busy sales season that is approaching.

His goal for the future is to buy a home, and his biggest challenge is to have enough savings to accomplish his goals, for which he plans to expand his customer base in order to sell much more merchandise.  With this, he will be able to gradually achieve his dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase footwear, handbags, and sandals.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a farmer living in the Kitale area of North Rift, Kenya, an area with a high maize output. He is married and has four children and he has been farming for seven years, with his primary income being milk, maize, vegetables, a taxi boda-boda, offering transportation services, and a retail business. He enjoys farming because of the profits he gets while his biggest challenge is lack of finances for expanding his agricultural projects.

Benjamin joined Juhudi Kilimo because he saw his friends agriculturally prosper with the asset financing loans that Juhudi offers. During the training, he learned more about teamwork and working together as a group. Through this loan, he will purchase poultry and, thus, his income will increase, so he will be able to pay for his children's education and also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 36 years old. She is married with four children, and only three attend school. She sells sorghum and has been in this business for the past nine months. She plans to use the profits for providing food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives in Jermuk town with her 3-year-old son and her husband. 

She works at a local insurance company as an operator and her husband is an policeman.

Together with her part-time work, Lilit also runs a farm. Particularly, Lilit keeps four cows, two calves, and three oxen.

Despite of her young age, Lilit perfectly manages to sustain her farm and take care of her little son. 

The requested loan of USD 2,600 will be a big support for Lilit to pay for land rental costs. She asks for this support to be able to enlarge her agribusiness activities. 

As this is Lilit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for land rental costs

loans.name: Devothe

texts.en: Devothe is 42 years old. She sells used shoes and has been in the business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more used shoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes for resale

loans.name: Cooproriz Isabane Gp8 Group

texts.en:
Chantal is 26 years old. She is married to a farmer and they both have two children. She has spent five years in the business. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer during rice production.  They need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that, in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors to enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and red oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, onions and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products for her store to resell

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  7   personas  emprendedores   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “EBENEZER”.  La Sra. Ruth    de 51  años de edad casada y con 3 hijos, la Sra. Ruth   tiene una pequeña bodega (alquilado)  hace unos  9  años. La Sra. Ruth  con la ayuda de su familia a sabido salir adelante tanto así que  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su productos (azúcar, café, leche, arroz etc.) . Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos y así   seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Ruth    y  todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Ruth  se le distingue por su chompa de color verde claro  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The Ebenezer communal bank is a  group made up of seven enterprising people with a great deal of creativity in business. 

Señora Ruth is 51 years old and married with three children. Ruth has had a small rented grocery store for about nine years. Ruth, with the help of her family, has figured out how to make a living. She has also managed to win the loyalty of her customers, which has generated earnings that allow her to cover her household costs. In the future, she would like to own her own shop where she could sell her products (sugar, coffee, milk, rice, etc.). 

With the loan granted, Ruth will invest in the purchase of more products so that she can continue satisfying her customers' needs and thus be able to support herself. She and all the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan granted, and for the trust that has been placed in them. 

Señora Ruth can be recognized by her light green shirt. She concludes with the promise that she will fulfill all her stated objectives.

loans.use: to buy legumes, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Catalina Huanca Group

texts.es: Giuliana   de 45 años de edad soltera  y sin hijos,  Giuliana  tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza   ya hace unos 2 años. Giuliana ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes  el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  Giuliana   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Giuliana  se encuentra parada se le distingue por su blusa de color azul se encuentra al costado del caballero, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Giuliana is 45 years old, single and has no children. Giuliana has had a small business selling beauty products for 2 years now. Giuliana has earned the loyalty of her customers which has generated a profit to be able to cover the household expenses. 

In the future, she would like to have her own store where she could sell her products and achieve greater economic gains. With the given loan she will invest in purchasing more products for her business (cosmetics) and thus continue to meet the needs of her customers and be able to get ahead. 

Collectively, Giuliana and all the members are grateful for Kiva for the loan that was granted and for the trust they have been given. Giuliana can be spotted standing in the blue shirt, alongside the gentleman. She says goodbye with the promise that she will fulfill all of the proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Las Tres Madres Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario es coordinado por la señora Maryery una mujer exitosa en su negocio y de 24 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijo menores de edad, se dedica a comercializar productos artesanales en los departamentos y principalmente en el país vecino de Honduras, solicita el crédito para la compra de productos artesanales como cotonas, hamacas, repujados, sandalias de cuero, adornos elaborados de barro, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Alicia de 44 años propietaria de una fritanga en su domicilio e Ivania de 28 años comerciante de ropa y calzado en su comunidad y helados en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is coordinated by Maryery, a successful 24-year-old woman, married and with three young children. She makes a living selling handicrafts around the districts of her country and, mainly, in the neighboring country of Honduras.  She is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts, such as cotton shirts, hammocks, embossed ornaments, leather sandals, clay ornaments, etc.

The other members are: Alicia, 24, who makes a living selling fried food from her home; and Ivania, 28, who sells clothes and shoes around the community and ice-cream at her home.

loans.use: to buy vases, embossed ornaments, hammocks and cotton shirts.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 41 years old from Kitiri in Nyandarua South. She is married and is supporting six children who are aged between 18 and 6 years old.

Lydia has a greengrocer business, which she has been running for the past five years. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy potatoes and onions to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and onions

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is 21 years old and lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. He is a student at the paid division of Vanadzor State Agricultural University. 

Simultaneously with his education, he works in Stepanavan city at the Gas Station, as a locksmith. Vladimir does his best to cover the cost of his education himself. 

Vladimir lives with his parents and his sister. Now his father is unemployed, and his mother and sister work at the school as teachers. Now Vladimir is busy with his work on a diploma, for which he needs computer very much.

He asks for this loan in order to buy a computer, which will be of great use and provide a lot of important information while he is doing his diploma work.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which will be of great use for his diploma work.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 43 years old. He runs a poultry farming business in Kapsabet town served by the VisionFund Kenya Kapsabet Branch.

He has been in this business for the last six years. From this business he gets a monthly income of KES 51,000.

Julius has borrowed a loan of KES 100,000, which he will use to purchase a chicks incubator. 

With the anticipated profits he will be able to repay the loan and expand his business.

His dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a chicks incubator

loans.name: Zepyur

texts.en:
Zepyur is an agronomist with many years of experience. She lives in Stepanavan town with her husband who is a teacher at school.
Zepyur cultivates grass as forage for the livestock. She sells it to local farmers in Stepanavan town.

The requested loan of USD 1,500 will be a great support for Zepyur to purchase needed corn seeds for cultivation. She will be very thankful if lenders support her with agricultural business and give her a chance to develop it further.

loans.use: to pay for corn seeds.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 30 years old. She is married with one child. She sells spare parts for both motorcycles and bicycles. With the loan, she would like to buy more spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Emilya

texts.en:
Emilya is from Stepanavan town. She lives there with her husband and is involved in agriculture. She keeps four cows, a pig, and some calves. Emilya milks cows, makes cheese, and sells it to a local cheese-selling company.

Emilya is very hardworking woman who takes care of her farm with great love and pleasure. The requested loan of USD 1,200 will be a great support for Emilya's farm. She plans to purchase forage for the livestock and continue her cheese production. 

Emilya will be very thankful to lenders for their support to her small agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida lives in Goris town with her family: husband, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. Because of the severely cold climate, locals here are mainly involved in cattle breeding activities. 

Armida and her family are also engaged in cattle breeding. They keep cows, calves, sheep, pig and piglets. Armida also keeps ten colonies of bees and gets high-quality honey.

The requested loan of USD 2,500 will be a big support for Armida to enlarge her number of livestock by fourteen sheep. She will be very grateful if lenders support her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for 14 sheep.

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 30 years old. He sells airtime and mobile money services for different telecommunications companies operating in the country. 

He has spent four years in the business, and would like to get a loan to invest in buying more airtime vouchers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and expand his venture.

loans.use: To buy more airtime vouchers for sale.

loans.name: Ricki Nelson

texts.es: Siguiendo sus propios sueños el Joven Ricki de 24 años de edad, residente actual de la Capital Managua nos demuestra que sus sueños no quedaran atrás como una simple idea y solo expectativas porque él lucha por alcanzar sus sueños; de esa misma forma nos expone que su meta próxima es pasar a su curso de titulación y graduarse; solicitando un crédito para lograr la culminación sus estudios superiores que cursa; estimando que el crédito a solicitud por la parte interesada le será de muchísima utilidad para poder finalizar sus estudios, y nos regala sus planes a futuros que son los de poner en práctica sus conocimientos adquiridos durante muchos años y sacar adelante a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: I was as timid as a child. Following his own dreams, the young man Ricki, who is 24 years old, is now a resident of the capital, Managua. He shows us that his dreams didn't remain behind like a simple idea or mere expectations, because he strives to reach his dreams. In the same way, he explains to us that his next goal is to pass his degree course and graduate. He is applying for a loan to manage to pay for the completion of the higher education that he is now enrolled in. He feels that the loan that he has applied for through the interested party will be very useful to him to be able to complete his studies, and he shares with us his future plans, which are to put the knowledge he has acquired into practice for many years and to raise his loved ones.

loans.use: to pay for the completion of his higher education.

loans.name: Leonel De Jesus

texts.es:
Al entrar a la tienda de zapatos de Don Leonel te recibe con una mezcla de olor  nuevo y aire limpio, al mismo tiempo quedas encantado por la amabilidad con la que atiende este humilde señor. Soltero a sus 58 años. Es un hombre disciplinado y trabajador. Hace tres año abrió su tienda, la que poco a poco ha sacado adelante, esta le ha brindado estabilidad económica. 
Don Leonel, solicita un nuevo crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo, comprando zapatos para hombres, mujeres y niños; de igual manera sandalias. Él está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindó Kiva y MiCrédito en el primer préstamo, ya que logró ampliar su inventario de zapatos, asimismo el número de clientela. Uno de sus sueños, es que su negocio siga en alza, para asegurarse un futuro tranquilo y seguro.
texts.en:
On entering Leonel's shoe store, you smell the mix of new smells and clean air. at the same time you are enchanted by the friendliness with which his humble man attends to you. At 56 years old he is single. He is hard-working and disciplined. Three years ago he opened his store and little by little he has advanced, bringing him financial stability.

Leonel is requesting a new loan to increase his working capital buying shoes and sandals for men, women and children. He is very grateful for the opportunity Kiva and MiCrédito provided him with his first loan as he was able to expand his inventory of shoes and increase his clientele. One of his dreams is to continually expand his business to assure a peaceful and secure future.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals for men. women and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like Lipton tea, milk, and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, soap, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eggs to resell at her market table.

loans.name: Pacanal 1, B2 Group

texts.es:
Melchor tiene 36 años de edad (es el que parece en la foto de primero de izquierda a derecha, viste playera de color negro) tiene dos hijos, el primero tiene 15 años de edad estudia primero básico y el otro tiene 7 años de edad estudia primero primaria, Melchor obtiene sus ingresos en la venta de hojas de maxán, lo vende en la comunidad donde vive por que llegan muchos  compradores de la capital, solicita un préstamo para el mantenimiento de maxán, con la ganancias que le dejan la venta de hojas de maxán piensa comprar terreno y sembrar más matas de maxán.
Se organizó en grupo para ayudarse entre ellos para el mantenimiento del máxan y además tiene mejores oportunidades de vender a un mejor precio sus productos
texts.en:
Melchor is 36-years-old (he's pictured in the photo first from the left, in the black t-shirt).  He has two children.  The first one is 15 and in seventh grade.  The other is 7 and in first grade.  Melchor earns his living selling maxan leaves in the community where he lives; a lot of buyers come from the capital.  He is seeking a loan for upkeep of his maxan.  He plans to use earning from selling the maxan leaves to buy a plot of land and plant more maxan.  

A group got together so members could help each other maintain their maxan and have better opportunities to sell their product for a higher price.

loans.use: for upkeep of his maxan plants.

loans.name: Krishne

texts.en:
Krishne thanks all his Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production. With this help, he can realize his long-term loans. 

He has repaid his loan fully, and with the help of Kiva lenders, he could save some money for his children’s studies. 

In order to produce, he will require loans from Seva in the coming seasons. That’s why Krishne is asking Kiva lenders for more help for his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Munaroh

texts.en:
Munaroh runs a small stall where she sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Munaroh is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Munaroh began working with Ruma five months ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Aref

texts.en:
Aref is a 23-year-old married man with two children. His oldest child is four years old and the youngest one is one year old. Aref studied until secondary school. Due to the miserable condition of his family, Aref couldn't complete his study. This thing makes him feels sad. But Aref doesn't surrender to his condition. He has a strong determination, and he strives to provide his family with a better life. From the beginning, Aref depended on himself, and he assumed all his responsibility. Now, Aref is the sole breadwinner of his family, and his wife works as a housewife. 

His house lacks many appliances, and most of them are very old, so he wants to purchase new appliances. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, he requested a Youth loan of 100,000 YER in order to purchase home appliances for his house. Aref looks forward to sending his children to a private school. He hopes of purchasing a piece of land and to build his own house and save the money that he pays for his rented house.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for his house.

loans.name: José Israel

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación. Este acompañado, es padre de 4 hijos de los cuales en casa del cliente solo viven los dos últimos quienes se dedican a la agricultura al igual que él. La pareja de José se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en temporadas al comercio informal  en casa.


José se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol, ajonjolí entre otros productos agrícolas desde hace 26 años. Esta actividad la aprendió de su familia,  pues José no tuvo otra forma de trabajar más que la agricultura y es por eso que desde muy pequeño aprendió a cultivar.  Además de la agricultura,  también es jornal y es un ingreso adicional que genera.  El trabajo está a 3 kilómetros de su casa, viaja a pie y en ocasiones lo hace en carreta, en el negocio se involucran los hijos del cliente y en ocasiones su esposa,  el horario de trabajo es de 7 horas diarias aproximadamente.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar abono, semilla, y fertilizantes. Para el cultivo agrícola. El préstamo le ayudara a tener los insumos necesarios para sembrar  el maíz, y frijol.
Esto vendrá  a mejorar  la producción y por tanto los ingresos del cliente y así ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

Los sueños de José son tener su propio negocio donde pueda vender los productos que cultiva, para su familia desea que ellos cumplan sus sueños y logren sus objetivos espera para sus hijos sean personas de bien y enseñarles a trabajar.
texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old and has a second grade education.  He is married and the father of four children, but only two live with him and they farm, as he does.  Jose’s wife is a housewife and seasonally sells things out of her home.

Jose raises corn, beans, sesame seeds, and other farming products and has done this for 26 years.  He learned this from his family.  Besides farming, he also works as a worker for extra income.  He works 3km from his home and walks there or sometimes travels by buggy.  His children, and sometimes his wife, are involved in the business and they work about seven hours a day. 

He will use the money from this loan to buy compost, seeds, and fertilizer.  This loan will help him to have the necessary supplies to raise corn and beans, improve his production and provide his family with a better quality of life.

Jose’s dreams are to have his own business to sell the products he raises.  He also wants his family to achieve its dreams and for his children to become persons of means and teach them to work.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new machines for working the land

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
Shahzadi is 29 years old and from a small village, Bagmari, in the district of Deoghar, Jharkhand. She lives with her husband and two children; a daughter and a son who go to school. Both husband and wife are illiterate, as their families could not afford the school fees, but they are working day and night to ensure their children are educated. 

Shahzadi’s husband, in search of work, reached Mumbai and got into the tailoring business. But he couldn’t stay away from home for long, and hence, came back to his village and started a construction business. He earns around INR 300 per day. Their income from agriculture is INR 10,000 per annum.

Even after all the hard work, Shahzadi’s husband is not able to manage the household expenses, as prices are going up day by day. So Shahzadi, being a very energetic and optimistic woman, does not want to give up and is requesting a loan of INR 10,000 to purchase materials, especially wood, needed for her husband’s business.

All she asks for in life is to overcome the financial hurdles they are facing and hopes their business keeps growing. She also wants to save enough for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy wood for construction work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Maria Pascuala

texts.es: María tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida  y su pequeña hija de 2 años de edad. María se gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos y de esta forma junto con el apoyo de su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. María y su familia habitan en condiciones muy humildes por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda y para pagar por la conexión de la energía eléctrica dado que actualmente no cuenta con el servicio . Espera tener acceso al financiamiento y así poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 24 years old and lives in a home of her own along with her life’s partner and her two year old daughter.  Maria earns a living by providing domestic services and she and her husband are able to support the household.  Maria and her family live under very humble conditions and she has decided to ask for this loan to buy cement, sand, and gravel to install a cement floor in the home, and to pay to have electricity installed because they don’t have it at this time.  She hopes to get this loan so she can continue to improve her quality of life little by little.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Glenda Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora  Glenda Xiomara  de 42  años de edad es casada , tiene  5 hijos  que dependen de ella y radican en la comunidad Guascoran Valle, , al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 30 años  al negocio de la elaboración y venta de artesanías o alfarería,  desde su juventud ha sido esta su actividad ya que sus padres también se dedicaron a esta actividad, en su taller ella trabaja con sus hijas, ambas ya graduadas de secundaria y por la falta de empleo trabajaban ayudándole a ella, Doña Glenda es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación.
Doña Glenda esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de materia prima como arcilla, pinturas y otros materiales que ella emplea para fabricar sus artesanías, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende comprar por mayor la materia prima, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita a Prisma es una buena clienta.
Doña Glenda su sueño es tener el mejor taller de artesanías de la zona. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014
texts.en:
Señora Glenda Xiomara is 42 years old. She is married and has five children who depend on her; they reside in the community of Guascoran Valle in the south of Honduras. She owns her own house and has earned her living for 30 years by making and selling crafts or pottery. Since her youth, this has been her occupation, as her parents also work in this trade. In her workshop, she works with her daughters. Both already graduated from secondary school and, for lack of employment, are working helping her. 

Doña Glenda is an example of hard work and dedication. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of raw materials like clay, paints, and other materials that she uses to make her artisanal crafts. With the support of this loan, she plans to buy raw materials at wholesale. This is the fourth loan she has requested from Prisma; she is a good client.

Doña Glenda's dream is to have the best artisanal crafts workshop in the area.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2014

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like clay, paints, and other materials that she uses to create her artisanal pottery

loans.name: Morena Elizabeth

texts.es: Morena tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 años y 8 años  de edad. Morena posee una pequeña tienda en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad y además los fines de semana vende ricas pupusas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.) Ella es muy trabajadora y visionaria y desea reparar las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda y para construir una canaleta para sacar las aguas grises. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en:
Morena is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children who are 17 and 8 years old. She has a small store in which she sells a variety of staple goods, and on the weekends she sells delicious pupusas (corn tortilla filled with beans, cheese, etc.). 

She is a hard worker and a forward thinker who wants to make repairs to her house, so she has made the decision to ask FUSAI for a loan. She will use the money to make repairs to the roof of the house and to construct a drain to remove the dirty water. She will buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal, and wood.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal, and wood to fix the roof of her house and  build a drain.

loans.name: Gs Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El señor Migdonio  de 46 años de edad,   tiene 3  hijos   que dependen  de él, vive con su conyugue en su casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad de la cuesta, al sur de Honduras.
Don Migdonio se dedica desde hace 08  años al negocio de venta maíz, leña seca, el también es albañil construye casa, que es otra fuente de ingreso para su hogar, El está construyendo en estos momentos su casa, es el líder del grupo solidario nueva esperanza, sus compañeros lo eligieron por ser una persona seria y muy honesta en sus compromisos. 
Don Migdonio está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de 2,000 tejas para su casa y al igual que los demás compañeros de grupo doña María que vende tortillas, doña Sunilda también vende tortillas y ropa nueva, son personas muy humildes pero muy trabajadoras y honestas.
 El sueño de Migdonio es mejorar su casa,
 San Lorenzo, Honduras. Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Migdonio is 46 years old and has three children who are dependent on this. He lives with his spouse in his own home, located in the community of La Cuesta in southern Honduras. Migdonio has sold corn and firewood for eight years. He also works in construction building houses, which is an additional source of income for his household. He is now building his own home and is the leader of his solidarity group called "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope). His group members chose him because he is a serious and honest person with his commitments. 

Migdonio is requesting this loan to buy 2,000 tiles for his home. His other group members, María who sells tortillas and Sunilda who sells tortillas and new clothing, are also modest but hard-working and honest people. Migdonio's dream is to improve him home.

loans.use: to buy 2,000 roof tiles.

loans.name: Danila

texts.es: Danila pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” y continúa dedicándose  a la actividad artesanal, en la elaboración de elementos de cuero como monederos, carteras, bolsas, cinturones etc. Danila en esta como en anteriores oportunidades  está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como cuero, hilos y accesorios.
texts.en: Danila belongs to the "Los Diamantes" communal bank and continues to make a living from hand-crafting, producing leather items such as coin purses, wallets, bags, belts, etc. As in previous opportunities, Danila is requesting the loan to purchase materials such as leather, thread, and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as leather, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es: Yovanna pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” y sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesanía, principalmente de elementos de joyería en plata como aretes, pulseras, collares, anillos, etc.  Yovanna realiza este trabajo hace algunos años, el cual representa su principal actividad económica y sustento de su familia. Yovanna está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo aretes y collares.
texts.en:
Yovanna belongs to the “Los Diamantes” communal bank and continues making a living from the business selling crafts, mainly elements of silver jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc. Yovanna has worked for some years in this job, which represents her main economic activity and support for her family. 

Yovanna is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as, for example, earrings and necklaces.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as, for example, earrings and necklaces.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot pertenece al banco comunal "LOS DIAMANTES" y continua dedicandose al negocio de venta y confeccion de cortinas, ella lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas estbalecidas.
texts.en: Margot belongs to the "Los Diamantes" (The Diamonds) communal bank. She continues making a living making and selling curtains. She has had this business for a long time, and it is going well for her thanks to the work that she puts into the business each day. She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale fabrics. Margot is grateful for the loan provided and is committed to fulfill her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Josefa María

texts.es: La señora Josefa  es una mujer trabajadora de 23 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 6 y 2 años por quiénes se ha dedicado a la compra-venta de cosechas desde hace cinco anos, solicita el crédito para la compra de cosechas de jocote, mango y papaya por ser las frutas que más demanda tienen en esta temporada. La socia con créditos obtenidos en la institución ha logrado realizar mejoras en su vivienda, por lo que la ha motivado a seguir prestando en esta institución.
texts.en: Josepha is a hardworking 23 year old married lady.  She has two children, ages 6 and 2.  She has been selling harvested products since she was five years old and is asking for this loan to buy cauliflower, mango, and papaya because these are the most demanded fruits this season.  She has been able to use previous loans to make improvements to her home.  This has motivated to continue borrowing from this institution.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson, 52 years old, is from Nyandarua South. He is married and supports four children who are between 25 and 14 years old.

Johnson has a farming business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm.

He hopes to improve his family's living standard in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia is 31 years old. He is married and together they have been blessed with two children. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Zacharia would like a loan of KES 80.000 to add to his milk stock to supply to his customers. 

He currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 96,000 and has successfully paid back all his previous loans.

loans.use: to add to his supply of milk

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 42 years old, is from Kinamba in Naivasha. He is married and supports two children who are in school.

John is a water vendor and has been vending for many years. He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy a donkey to help in transporting the water to his clients.

He hopes to open a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a donkey

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale.

loans.name: Pedzisai

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulawayo, the second largest city in Zimbabwe. This is Pedzisai, who is 36 years old and married with three children, two of whom are attending school. 

Pedzisai has, for 14 years, run a retail shop, selling clothing items. He has three employees to assist him. Pedzisai's main challenge has been his inability to meet customers demands due to limited working capital.

Pedzisai has requested a $750 loan to buy clothing items for resale. He says that the profits generated from the loan will help pay school fees for his children and household expenses. In the future, Pedzisai, plans on opening his own clothing boutique.

loans.use: to by clothing items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to consolidate his debts with a commercial bank that has provided him with the majority of his furniture and his motorcycle to do his work.

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Sahida, 20, lives in Parandih, Deoghar, a highly populated rusty town. Most people in this area work as labourers in the construction industry. She has a son studying in school, and a daughter goes to ICDS centre (pre-school).   

Her husband started poultry farming two years ago and is earning some profits. Sahida helps her husband in this business. They earn INR 200 daily and INR 20,000 per annum from agriculture.    

Sahida is a young, idealistic entrepreneur; she always looks for growth. She now wants to expand her poultry farm, for which she is asking for a loan to buy more hens for breeding.  

Not many families produce agricultural products in this area, and people normally buy food. This is where Sahida’s business is in demand, as people there prefer chicken. She believes that the supply and demand chain will allow her to have more customers, if only she can procure more. She is confident that the expansion will surely give her enough income to maintain her family and help her save enough money for her children’s education. 

Sahida believes that the surging market will increase demand, and hopes to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy more hens.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is from Arevabuyr village. She is a mother of two little sons (in the photo) and lives with her husband and parents-in-law.

Lida runs a farm with her family members. Specifically, they keep a greenhouse where potatoes and beans are cultivated. They sell the gathered harvest in the market and gather income for their living. 

The requested loan of USD 1,500 will be a great support for this family to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to pay for the workforce for gathering the harvest. Please help them to enlarge their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer and pay for the workforce for gathering the harvest.

loans.name: Blanca Lilia

texts.es:
Blanca en una mujer trabajadora y siempre buscando el bienestar para ella y sus hijos, por esta razón ha trabajado gran parte de su vida para ganarse el sustento.
Ella tiene un negocio en su propia casa que consiste en la preparación de tamales y morcilla, alimentos muy populares en Medellín (Colombia). Estos alimentos los prepara y los vende a través de encargos que le hacen sus clientes, que son principalmente vecinos, amigos y familiares. 
En estos momentos tiene pensado iniciar un negocio de venta de fritos como empanadas y pasteles de pollo, este negocio piensa ubicarlo en la parte de afuera de su casa y trabajara en el en las horas de la mañana.
Ella actualmente solicita un apoyo económico para comprar una freidora y una carpa, de este modo podrá ofrecer sus alimentos mas cómodamente y con mejor servicio a sus clientes. Esto hará que sus ingresos aumenten.
Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio grande y ofrecer un empleo a otra persona que lo necesite, adicional a esto desea comprar una casa y heredarla a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a hard-working woman who is always looking after her and her children’s well-being. It is for this reason that she has worked most of her life to make a living.

She has a business in her own home that consists of the preparation of tamales and blood sausages, foods that are very popular in Medellín (Colombia). She prepares and sells these foods through orders made by her customers, who are mainly neighbors, friends, and family members.

At this time she is thinking of opening a business selling fried foods, such as empanadas and chicken pastries. She is thinking of situating this business out front of her home and working in the morning hours.

She currently is requesting economic support to purchase a deep-fryer and an awning. This way, she will be able to offer her foods more conveniently and with better service for her customers. This will increase her income.

Her main dream is to have a large business and to offer a job to another person who needs it. Additionally, she wishes to purchase a home and leave it to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a deep-fryer and an awning to put outside of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken, pig's feet, pig's tail, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Marta es una joven mujer de 36 años que ha tenido que sortearse entre diferentes circunstancias difíciles. Inicialmente trabajo vendiendo productos por catalogo, luego paso a administrar un tienda en un municipio cercano, desafortunadamente la dueña del negocio falleció y ella se vio obligada a buscar un sustento para ella y su hija.
Fue así como decidió iniciar con su propio negocio aprovechando la experiencia adquirida y abrió una tienda de abarrotes y comestibles; hasta el sol de hoy ha tenido buen reconocimiento y trayectoria en el sector.
Actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar un buen surtido en verduras y legumbres para su negocio y así poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes satisfaciendo todas sus necesidades.
Su mayor sueño es tener un minimercado en el cual ofrecer infinidad de productos y alimentos, adicional a esto abrir otra tienda y obtener ingresos extra para obtener un poco mas de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is a young woman who is 36 years and who has had to negotiate a variety of difficult circumstances. At first she worked selling products from a catalog and then she ran a store in a nearby village. Unfortunately, the owner of the store passed away and she had to look for another way to support herself and her daughter. 

Taking advantage of the experience she gained, she decided to start her own business and opened a grocery store which up to now has been well recognized in the area and is doing well. She is now asking for a loan so that she can buy a good variety of greens and vegetables for her business, offering more of a variety to her customers and satisfying their needs. Her big dream is to have a mini-market where she can offer an infinite number of products and food items, and to open yet another store for a little extra income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a good variety of greens and vegetables for her store.

loans.name: Gloria Helena

texts.es:
Gloria, una mujer simpática e infatigable que refleja en su mirada toda una vida llena de experiencia tiene un proyecto de vida muy claro el cual piensa cumplir con perseverancia y entrega.
Ella tiene un pequeño taller de confección a terceros en el cual confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas a través de contratos, actualmente trabaja sola pero su interés es poder dar empleo a más personas.
Ella vive con sus dos hijos y tuvo que tomar toda la responsabilidad del hogar al separarse del hombre que era su esposo.
Actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar insumos de confección y así poder empezar a fabricar y vender su propia línea de ropa, esto le dará independencia económica y una mayor cantidad de ingresos para sostener su hogar.
Su mayor aspiración es poder tener un taller grande confección y seguir vigente en este insaciable mercado de gran consumismo.
texts.en:
Gloria is a friendly and tireless woman who reflects a life full of experiences. She has a very clear plan for her life that she expects to fulfill through perseverance and devotion. She has a small workshop where she makes clothing based on contracts.  Currently, she works alone, but she is interested in providing employment for others.  She lives with her two children, and had to take responsibility of the household after she separated from her husband.  

Currently, she is seeking a loan to purchase supplies to make clothing so that she can start to make and sell her own line of clothing.  This will provide her with financial independence and a higher income to sustain her household. Her greatest aspiration is to have a larger workshop and to continue to work in this insatiable, consumer market.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as fabric, thread, lace and buttons.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesús

texts.es:
Carmen de 51 años de edad,  es una persona que estudio sexto grado y es  casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Carmen se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo para realizar sus actividades diarias y sus hijos le colaboran.

Carmen se dedica a comercializar frutas de temporada, oficio que le ha enseño su madre, mientras su esposo trabaja en la parcela junto a sus hijos camina 3 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde ella se dedica a comprar mas frutas para el siguiente día ir a vender. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono, semilla, herbicidas,  etc y podrá  obtener una buena cosecha e incrementar sus ingresos con la venta de esta.

Carmen planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de frutas y  del préstamo para la siembra podrá en un futuro  comprar  vacas y  poder producir leche para la venta.
texts.en:
Carmen is 51 years old, and she has attended school through the sixth grade. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture. Carmen gets up at 4:30 a.m. along with her husband in order to carry out her daily activities, and her children help her.

Carmen sells seasonal fruit—work that her mother taught her—while her husband works on their parcel of land together with their children, walking three kilometers to get there. In the afternoon she purchases more fruit in order to sell it the following day. 

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of compost, seed, herbicides, etc., so that she will be able to achieve a better harvest, and increase her income with the sale. With the income that she earns from fruit sales, and from the farm loan, Carmen plans to be able to purchase cows and produce milk for sale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seed, herbicides, etc., in order to achieve a good harvest and increase her income with the sale.

loans.name: Rusli

texts.en:
Rusli runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Rusli lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Rusli is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Rusli began working with Ruma two years ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Firdosh

texts.en:
Firdosh, 24, lives in Bagmari village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. He is married and has two daughters who are going to school.  

Firdosh reached Mumbai in search of work and started working in a yarn manufacturing factory almost 1,800 km away from his family. After a few years, he could not hold himself being away from his family and returned to his village.

Firdosh started working in a grocery shop in the village and is paid INR 250 per day, which is not sufficient to run his family.

Firdosh is young and energetic and did not want to give up. So, he is planning to start his own footwear and doormat shop, as there is quite a demand for these in his village. He is seeking a loan of INR 15,000 to buy in bulk and stock up. He hopes this business will get him some profits and help him sustain his family.

Firdosh wants to save enough money for his daughters’ education and for their marriages, too.

loans.use: to buy footwear and doormats.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana de 50 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla con sus hijos de 29 y 24 años. Ella se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 10 años, cuando le propusieron vincularse a la venta de productos mediante guías especializadas y ella decidida, empezó a venderle a sus compañeros de trabajo, que le pagaban poco a poco, de acurde a sus ingresos y fue agregando muchos artículos, que vendía sobre los pedidos de su clientela. En la actualidad vende a crédito y de contado, trabaja diariamente todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y compra a crédito y de contado a proveedores que reconocen su seriedad en las transacciones. 
Ana hoy  está aplicando aun credikiva, primer Financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía en promoción ropa, perfumería y maquillajes. Su meta es tener un almacén de mayor tamaño comprar finalmente una casa y como meta inmediata hacer que su clientela crezca para ganar un poco mas y este es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old. She lives in the city of Barranquilla with her 29 and 24 year old children.  She has worked in retail for the past 10 years.  She started when she was asked to start selling products from specialized catalogs.  She decided to join and started to sell to her coworkers who paid her little by little based on their income. She started to add more products that she sold based on her customers' orders. Currently, she sells on credit and in cash, and she works everyday from 8am to 8pm. She buys her merchandise, on credit and in cash, from purveyors that recognize her seriousness in their transactions. 

Today, Ana is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has sought from the Fundación Santon Domingo. She will use the loan to purchase merchandise that is on sale such as clothing, perfumes and makeup.  Her goals are to have a large store and purchase a home. Her more immediate goal is to grow her customer base so that she can earn a little more.  This is precisely the goal of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise on sale such as clothing, perfumes and makeup.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en: Marceline is 33 years old. She is married to a house builder and blessed with a pair of twins. With the loan, she would like to buy more retail items and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to add more sale items to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more retail items and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 29 years old, is a married man living in a rural area with his family of two children. One of his children attends school in a different area. He deals in the cattle trading business. He has additional income from agriculture where he grows maize, beans and bananas (matooke).  He started this business in 2005.

He works one day a week and 12 hours per day and he acquired this loan to buy more cattle for trade. He has hopes of expanding into a large business. His clients are fellow cattle traders from surrounding places

The challenges he faces are the lack of pastures and water during the sunny seasons. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He appreciates the lenders and the services offered to him.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Jorge Hernán

texts.es:
Jorge es un humilde y laborioso agricultor que toda subida se ha dedicado a las labores agotadoras y difíciles del campo. Vive junto a su esposa en una pequeña vivienda en la cual tienen lo necesario para subsistir.
Jorge se desempeña en varios oficios pasando por productor de café, obrero y porcicultor.
Recientemente adquirió cuatro lechones los cuales ha levantado con esfuerzo y planea venderlos en el mercado de su región.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar unas cuantas crías de cerdo para su engorde y levante, posteriormente venderlos y obtener ingresos para su hogar; adicional a estos necesita concentrados para la alimentación de sus animales.
Jorge tiene una visión y es poder tener una linda casa para vivir su vejez al lado de su esposa, también desea tener muchos cultivos de diferentes alimentos teniendo así una vida prospera.
texts.en:
Jorge is a humble and hardworking farmer that has dedicated his whole life  to exhausting and difficult work in the field.  He lives with his wife in a small home where they have the necessities for survival. Jorge works in a variety of jobs such as a coffee producer, a laborer, and a pig farmer. Recently, he acquired four suckling pigs, which he has raised and plans to sell in the local market.  

He is seeking a loan to purchase a few litters of pigs to fatten and raise. He will later sell them and earn an income for his household. In addition to the pigs, he needs feed for the animals.  Jorge has a vision of having a nice house where he can live out his old age next to his wife.  He also hopes to have many crops of different foods, allowing him to have a prosperous life.

loans.use: purchase litters of pigs to fatten and raise.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 34 year old married man living in a rural area with his family of six children.  Four children attend school.

He started his agriculture business in 2008 and he also trades produce.  James works seven days a week and 12 hours each day.  He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. 

He is seeking a loan to pay his children's tuition and to boast his produce business. James hopes to expand his business so he can supply all the people around.  His clients are traders from the city and surrounding places.

The challenges James faces are the high prices of pesticides and price fluctuation in the market.   His wish is that the institution provides its service at a much lower interest rate to make it more friendly.

loans.use: to pay school tuition for his children and enhance his produce business.

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik is from Ashotavan village where she lives with her mother and sister. Satik is a singer by profession. She works at a local art school. In addition to her part time work, Satik also runs a farm with her mother. They have been involved in the farming business for 10 years and currently own arable land where wheat, barley and potato are cultivated.

Satik is a very hard working girl with a lot of future goals. As she is very enthusiastic about developing their cultivation activities, Satik has applied for this loan of USD 1,200. The loan will greatly help Satik to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel. 

Satik and her family hope for the lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Ana Margoth

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer que gracias a los micro créditos ha logrado montar dos negocios, una tienda y una peluquería, considerada por su familia como una mujer muy luchadora, una mujer guerrera que no mira el reto si no que los afronta.
