The health of people and the completion of her studies are the primary goals of Ancristel so she decided to study to be a pharmacist. She's 21 years old, unmarried, and attending her fifth year of school. She is young, charismatic, intelligent, and enterprising. For her, every day is an opportunity to gain more knowledge. Her dream is to be an excellent pharmacist. She is very grateful to her father who has been her main support.
She requests funding for tuition and the monthly costs for the year of 2014. She puts her trust in the Kiva loan that MiCredito is offering because she will not miss any classes. If she does not pay on time, her exams will be rescheduled which would be an obstacle in her professionalization. One of her goals is to work in specializing and developing new drugs. She longs for a future full of possibilities.

loans.use: to pay tuition and monthly school costs

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo 2 in the western rural area in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 6 children. In 2003, Ramatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create income to educate her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes purchasing power is very slow.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase more rice, fish, palm oil and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Ramatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, palm oil and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children who are now adults. 

Lolita is engaged in fishing, particularly operating a fishing boat for their means of living. Lolita earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional fishing boat, fishing nets and other fishing equipment. 

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for almost 13 years. In the future, Lolita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing boat, fishing nets and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, age 46, is from Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. Judith joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services provided by the Coop. The Coop has supported her by providing the capital to start her fish vending business. From her desire to help her husband in supporting their family, she gives her best effort to sell all her fish, in order to continue putting bread and butter on the table for her family. 

Judith is now trying to expand her resources. She decided to engage in egg selling to earn more income. She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of 5,000 PHP. The loan is intended for egg selling capital. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to provide her family a good standard of living. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Marcus

texts.en:
Marcus grew up around cars and has been working on them since he was 15 years old with his dad who bought and sold custom restored cars. 

When Marcus moved to San Diego, he worked at various car dealerships doing detailing and maintenance. He eventually ended up in a job doing building maintenance in a high rise. One day when he came to work, he saw that the building had added an auto detailing service for its employees. Marcus told himself, “I could do that,” sparking a business idea that better fit his talents and experiences.

He eventually started Trophy Auto Spa, a full-service mechanic and detailing auto shop. Though starting at a storefront facility, his eventual goal is to acquire contracts with local companies to provide mobile detailing services for their employees. Marcus seeks to distinguish himself from his competitors through offering top quality service with integrity. Though still fairly new, Trophy Auto Spa already has rave reviews, with satisfied clients posting positive reviews on Yelp and spreading the word about Trophy Auto Spa.

This Kiva loan of $8,500 will enable Marcus to take courses at an auto detailing training school so that he can expand his services to include painless dent removal, windshield repair, window tinting and wheel recoating and restoration. 

In the future, Marcus hopes to expand into a larger facility. He would also like to train more employees and take over the auto detailing services offered at the office buildings in the area.

Check them out on the web at: http://www.trophyautospa.com

loans.use: to take courses at an auto detailing training school so that he can expand his offered services

loans.name: Azucena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Azucena es una persona de 37 años de edad,  que se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su casa se preocupa por mantener su casa con la salud e higiene,  ya que lo más importante para ella son su familia. Ella vivió y se creció con su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar esta actividad su abuela era una persona muy humilde y trabajadora y fue ella quien le enseño buenos valores morales y espirituales, y de esta forma poniendo en práctica todo la aprendido de su abuela ha podido salir adelante. Ella trabajo en un cafetín en el centro escolar del pueblo, y fue allí donde aprendió y adquirió experiencia en el comercio.  Transcurrió el tiempo y Azucena formo su hogar con quien se dedica a la agricultura y son padres de 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.  

Ella se dedica a la venta en un cafetín que está ubicado en el centro escolar de su comunidad que es de su propiedad también se dedica a los oficios domésticos se preocupa por mantener su hogar lo más higiénico posible, ya que su prioridad son su familia, esta labor la aprendió de su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar, y ella continua haciéndolo porque le enorgullece que sus hijos se sientan cómodos estando en su casa, su principal fuente de ingresos depende las ganancias que le da el cafetín que tiene en la escuela.


El dinero será utilizado en mejoramiento y ampliación de su casa, y mejorar el suministro de agua potable de su casa; ya que cuenta con un pozo perforado y es de mucha importancia darle el mantenimiento  y ponerle techo ya que se acerca la época de lluvia y de esta forma garantizara el derecho al agua saludable a su familia.

Las planes que ella tiene para un futuro son las de ampliar y mejorar su casa donde le reforzara las bases porque pretende a futuro construir una segunda planta, y apoyara la formación y educación de sus hijos hasta que ellos sean unos profesionales graduados. Con la ayuda de un nuevo préstamo invertirá en compra de un vehículo para hacer viajes.
texts.en:
Azucena is 37 years old. She performs the domestic tasks in her home. She is concerned about keeping her house healthy and hygienic, since the most important thing for her is her family. She lived with and grew up with her grandmother, who dedicated her whole life to performing this activity. Her grandmother was a very humble and hard-working person, and it was she who taught her good moral and spiritual values. In this way, putting in practice everything she learned from her grandmother, she has been able to move forward. She worked in a small café in the town’s educational center, and it was there that she learned and acquired experience in business. Time passed and Azucena formed her household with a farmer. They are parents to 4 children, who are studying at their community’s school.

She is in business at a small café, which she owns, located in her community’s educational center. She also performs the domestic tasks. She is concerned about keeping her house as hygienic as possible, since her priority is her family. She learned this work from her grandmother, who dedicated her whole life to performing her household’s domestic tasks, and she continues doing it because it fills her with pride for her children to feel comfortable in their home. Her main source of income relies on the earnings she gets from the small café she has in the school.

The money will be used to improve and expand her house, and to improve her house’s supply of potable water, since it has a drilled well and it is very important to maintain it and put a roof on it, since the rainy season is coming. In this way, she will guarantee her family’s right to healthy water.

The plans she has for the future are to expand and improve her house, where she will reinforce the foundation because she intends to build a second story in the future, and to support the training and education of her children until they have graduated and are professionals. With the help of a new loan, she will purchase a vehicle in order to take trips.

loans.use: to improve and expand her house, and to improve her house's potable water supply

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Kessy is a father of one son who is schooling. He is in his early 30s and is single. He manages to take his son to school and other staffs by employing himself. He has been managing a poultry business where he keeps local chickens from villages for selling. Kessy has been in this business for seven years now, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. He works from 7am to 6pm per day. Poultry is the only business Kessy has depended on for seven years to pay for his life welfare.

This is his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy chickens for selling. Kessy used the previous loan to restock his business with chickens so as to grow. He has paid back the previous loan successfully. With his profit, he paid the school fees and household expenses. He dreams that one day he will be able to open another successful project so that his extra income will rise. We believe that with your loan support, Kessy will be able to meet his dreams and open a light to his family.

He will share this loan with his loan group Mapatano, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens for selling.

loans.name: Milagros De Los Remedios

texts.es:
Milagros de 19 anos edad, casada, con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal,  en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia. En la actualidad lucha para brindarles un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo, y poder aumentar su capital de trabaja, para que sea un negocio prospero.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de Salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  una librería, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho hora diarias  ofreciendo su producto como: cuadernos, lapiceros, crayolas, papel crepe, papel lustrio, marcadores, resaltadores, libretas, reglas. Pega, grapas.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Milagros agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Milagros, 19, is married and has an underage child. She is from Leon, in the western part of the country. She is hard-working, responsible, and with a desire to get ahead in life. In her spare time she likes to enjoy her family's company. She is striving to provide a better future for her son and to increase her working capital to make her business thrive.
Thanks to her determination to get ahead, Milagros runs a bookstore from her home and works 8 hours per day, offering products such as exercise books, pencils, crayons, crepe paper, markers, notebooks, rulers, glue, staples, etc. The purpose of this loan is  to invest in working capital and buy groceries for her business in order to improve her income in the near future.
Milagros is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have decent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her bookstore with groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize grains to sell to customers who make maize into maize flour.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is from Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 43 years old and is married. Mercy and her husband help together in a fish vending business. It is their main source of income to sustain the needs of their family. Mercy has applied for membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop.  

Mercy is in need of additional capital to engage in a rice-selling business to earn more income. She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of 5,000 PHP. The loan is intended to start her rice selling business.  In addition, she wants to expand her business and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is 58 years old and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. She was gifted with six children. Nemesia is a widow and the breadwinner of the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her children. This industrious member operates a sari-sari general store business to earn a living and support her children. Aside from that, this industrious member finds herself ploughing the rice field, planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities to earn additional income. 

In need of additional capital, Nemesia decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to restock inventory for her sari-sari store. She deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing for continuous support from the Coop, and Nemesia is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to restock inventory for her sari-sari general store business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa como por ejemplo camisas, blusas, chompas, pantalones, polos y otras cosas mas y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo chompas y blusas para esta campaña por el día de la madre. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Delia lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in Southern Peru, and she belongs to the communal bank “Qory Chaska”, which is part of the microfinance institution, Asociación Arariwa. 

She sells clothing such as shirts, blouses, sweaters, pants, polo shirts, and other items. She has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well. 

On this occasion she is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise such as sweaters and blouses for this mother’s day season. She appreciates the loan that she is being given, and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 45 years old and married with two adult-age children. She lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occiental. She has been engaged in coconut farming with her husband for five years. She has a quarterly income of 15,000 PHP from the said coconut. Aida joined Paglaum in 2009 and has applied for several loans already. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer for the coconut trees. The profit she gains from this business will be saved for Paglaum, for savings, retirement, and to support their daily consumption.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her coconut trees.

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en:
Jovencio is 63 years old, married and a resident of Cangmohao, Siquijor. He earns a living through fishing. 

He has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, he is applying for a loan of Php 8,000 to  purchase additional fishing materials such as fish net.

Jovencio deeply wishes to maintain a membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing materials such as fish net.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, 66 years old, lives in Oroquieta-Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental Plaridel, Mindanao, Philippines. She was gifted with five children. 

Betty operates a sari-sari (general store) business. She decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for her start-up capital in the business. She has received several loans already and was able to pay all her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, Betty requested a PHP 14,900 loan for cocoland redemption, for which she could use the land to plant any agricultural commodity to earn more income. 

Being a MIGS (Member In Good Standing) member of the cooperative, Betty has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she might not have any savings at all, nor be properly guided in her finances. 

She hopes to own a mini-mart and a four-wheel vehicle someday, to use for delivering her own agricultural products in all nearby towns.

loans.use: pay for redemption of pawned cocoland.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion  is a 63 years old. She is married and has five children.
She has maintained the label of member in good standing and has taken several loans already. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer.
In the future she wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuing education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to purchase additional products for direct selling.

Maureen dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for direct sales.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and contining education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000. This loan is intended to purchase additional canned goods, shampoos, beverages and soft drinks for her sari-sari store.

Marilou  dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, shampoos, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuing education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 2,500. This loan is intended to purchase additional ingredients, meat and spices for food vending.

Edita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients, meat and spices.

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es: Orfelina es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 17 a 22 años. Ella habita en un barrio muy tradicional de la ciudad y desde hace 4 años, después de haber trabajado en una empresa como limpiadora de ropa, donde encontró una potencialidad de clientes que le sugerían venderle mercancías para ellas responderles con una frecuencia quincenal o mensual, decidió emprender su propia aventura empresarial como comerciante de variedades de artículos. Hoy ofrece a crédito a sus clientes ropa, calzado, abanicos, planchas, licuadoras a solicitud de ellos. Su meta es tener una miscelánea ubicada en un local comercial para aumentar sus ingresos y finalmente ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales. Su mayor desafío tener los suficientes recursos económicos para crecer y ver realizados sus sueños.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  dos vitrinas y mercancía variada como ropa calzado etc.. Con ello planea que su ventas se incrementen por su diaria rotación para poco a poco lograr sus propósitos soñados.
texts.en: Orfelina is the mother of three children ages 17 to 22 years old, and lives in a very traditional neighborhood in the city.  She had worked as a clothes cleaner in a company where she discovered potential customers who suggested that she sell them merchandise on a biweekly or monthly basis.   Then four years ago, she decided to undertake her own business venture selling a variety of articles.  Today, she offers credit to her customers on clothing, shoes, fans, irons, and blenders at their request.  Her goal is to have a miscellany shop located a in a local mall to increase her income and, finally see her children become professionals.  Her biggest challenge is to have sufficient financial resources to grow and see her dreams fulfilled.  This is the reason that she turned to Kiva, making her first loan with “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo”, through which she will purchase two glass display cases and various merchandise such as clothing, shoes, etc.  With the loan, she plans to increase her sales through daily rotation and gradually achieve her goals and dreams..

loans.use: to purchase two glass display cases and various merchandise such as clothing, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help her coffee crop in this second season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory to sell at her counter

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: MARY  es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en la comunidad de Chijipina Grande en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, la casa solo tiene luz y agua Mary se dedica a la agricultura y a la produccion de leche. Mary necesita credito para comprar una vaca de raza semimejorada para incrementar su produccion de leche, aunque Mary recibe colaboracion de sus padres, la situacion economica de la familia no es buena por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Mary is single and has no children. She lives in her own house made of adobe in the community of Chijipina Grande. The only services in her house are electricity and water.

Mary needs a loan in order to buy a cow of semi-improved breed so that she can increase her milk production. Even though Mary receives assistance from her parents, her family’s financial situation is not good. For this reason, she is need of help.

loans.use: to buy a cow for increasing milk production.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
San Lucas Tolimán is town of approximately 17,000 people that sits on the southeastern shore of Lake Atitlán in Guatemala. The Lake has been described by Aldous Huxley as “one of the most beautiful lakes in the world.” The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Emprenedoras” or “The Entrepreneurs” is located here and consists of 14 motivated women who are looking for ways to create better lives for themselves and their families. They are requesting a loan from KIVA in order to maintain and grow their businesses. Some of their business endeavors include animal husbandry and the sale of various foods including vegetables, snacks and items for daily consumption.
Marta is 46 years old, married, president of the Trust Bank, and has two children. Although she only has had two years of formal education, Marta is a self-taught woman who is filled with enthusiasm and urges her fellow Trust Bank members to move ahead and improve themselves. Marta is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase three pigs that she will raise and then sell. She hopes to receive a good price for them so that together with her husband, the needs of the family can be met. It is especially important to the couple they meet the educational expenses of their youngest son, who is in elementary school.
The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge combines small loans with non-formal education. As most of the clients have had little or no education, the ladies learn about various relevant and useful subjects from a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who meets with them each month. Some of these topics include effective business practices including accounting and budgeting, customer service and indebtedness. Among other subjects covered are nutrition and health, self esteem and women’s rights.
Each of the women in the Trust Bank extend their heartfelt thanks to KIVA investors for believing in them and funding their loans. They look forward to a brighter future as empowered women eliminating poverty! We look forward to sharing their progress with you!

loans.use: To purchase three pigs

loans.name: Lenin Alberto

texts.es:
Lenin de 42 años de edad, soltero con dos hijos  menores de edad,  los cuales están estudiando, es originario de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de video y cd de musica de forma ambulante, el dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del credito es comprar mas CD para ofrecer variedad y calidad a sus clientes. lenin agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lenin, 42, is single and has two children who are studying. He is from Leon, in the western part of the country, and he is hard-working, responsible, and with a desire to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, he was unable to get a degree due to lack of resources, and had to work from an early age to help with the household expenses. 
Thanks to his determination to get ahead, he runs a business selling music CDs and videos as a street vendor. He works 10 hours per day offering his products. The purpose of the loan is to buy more CDs in order to offer variety and quality to his customers. Lenin is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have decent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy CDs and music videos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second-hand car to let her husband start providing taxi service in town

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda previously received a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance on her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her child's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that all her children will have a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance on her motorized tricycle unit.

loans.name: Chelame

texts.en:
Chelame  is 28 years old, married, a resident of Bonga, Maria, Siquijor. She earns a living through raising pigs.

Chelame has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional feed and pigs.

Chelame deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married with four children. She is 40 years old and lives at Embargo, Ozamiz City.

To earn a living, Juanita is a farmer and laundress. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000. She applied for a loan for land redemption. Juanita has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

In the future, Juanita hopes to improve and be able to save money.

loans.use: to redeem her land.

loans.name: Jorge Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Jorge de  42 años de edad es casado, tiene tres hijos  que depende de él   radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  al negocio de  reparación de celulares, computadoras, etc.
Don Jorge le repara los celulares a los, amigos, vecinos, familiares y personas que le conocen que visitan su negocio, el también trabaja haciendo instalaciones eléctricas en oficinas y casas. Don Jorge es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
El esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de repuestos de celulares como Flex, pantallas, baterías, cobertores y memorias, también repuestos para computadoras como fuentes, memoria RAM y disco duro, con el apoyo de este crédito él pretende suplir  la necesidad de financiamiento, es su tercer crédito que solicita ha Prisma.
Don Jorge su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.
 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Jorge, 42,  is married and has 3 children that depend on him. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. He owns a house and has had a business repairing cell phones, computers, etc. for 10 years.
Jorge repairs cell phones for friends, neighbors, relatives and people who know him and who visit his business. He also works doing electrical installations in offices and homes. Jorge is a hard-working person with a desire to get ahead. He is asking for a loan to buy cell phone parts such as buffer pads, screens, batteries, cases and memory cards, and computer parts such as power sources, RAM memories and hard drives. With the support from this loan, Jorge wants to cover his financing needs. This is his third loan with the lending partner institution, Prisma. Jorge's dream is to improve his house and his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, March 2014.

loans.use: to buy cell phone parts such as buffer pads, screens, batteries, protective cases and memory cards as well as computer parts such as power sources, RAM memories and hard drives.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine sells produce in Hoima, Uganda. She started the business three years ago so as to supplement her cash inflow. She works six days a week. As a teacher, Josephine earns additional income from a salary. 

She desires to see her business grow. Weather changes affect her business expectations.

Josephine is acquiring a loan to buy more maize and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize and educate her children.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Besides the clothes-selling business, Regina operates a tailoring business. She is asking for a loan to purchase thread, fabrics and materials for her business. She is grateful for the renewed support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabrics and materials for her business

loans.name: Casmir

texts.en:
Casmir grew up in Kisii county and, later, moved to Nairobi where he works as a builder. He has four children and lives in Nairobi's Mukuru urban settlements. 

In an effort to provide a better lifestyle for his family and be able to cater to his children's education in the future, Casmir decided to start a small business. He embarked on a mission to identify the best business which he could easily manage. He learned about the Fresh Life franchise and thought it was the best option. 

Casmir seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. The income from the toilets will be used to repay his loan, expand his franchise, and provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Egga

texts.en:
Egga is a hardworking and enterprising woman who  owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with six adult children. 
Egga sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies so that she can maintain her coffee crops for the new season.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Teresa tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 19 años de edad y su hijo de 15 años de edad. Teresa es una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace mucho tiempo logró establecer una pequeña tienda en su hogar de habitación en la cual distribuye variedad de productos como: arroz, huevos, sal, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, detergente, etc. De esta forma logra sacar a delante a su familia y es su principal fuente de ingresos. Con el deseo de dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de inventario que le permita satisfacer a un mayor número de clientes y así poder mejorar sus ingresos que le permita dar mejores condicione de vida a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un mayor inventario para su negocio. con el monto solicitado comprará: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, golosinas, pan dulce, aceite, huevos, detergente y de más productos demandados por los clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa, 59, lives in her own house with her daughter, aged 19, and her son, aged 15. She is an enterprising woman who a long time ago managed to open a small store in her home. In the store she sells a variety of products such as rice, eggs, salt, sugar, oil, candy, detergent, etc. In this way, she provides for her family. This is her main source of income. Teresa has decided to invest in her business in order to improve the living conditions of her family. She wants to buy a larger stock to satisfy a larger number of customers and thus improve her income to better provide for her family.
Teresa is asking for a loan from the field partner, FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, salt, candy, sweet bread, oil, eggs, detergent, and other products demanded by her customers.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, salt, candy, sweet bread, oil, eggs, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Christine has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and expand on the business. 

Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to add more stock to the business. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, where she sells charcoal and bananas. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, wood, and bananas, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a business van. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, wood, and bananas

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Nuru, who is a mother of two children, is in her late twenties and is married. One of her children attends school. For five years now, Nuru has made her living through a genge business (fruits and vegetables). She starts her business at 8am and works until 7:30pm every working day. She is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is Nuru's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Though her husband is employed, the genge business supplements her husband's income, which helps her family get one step ahead. Nuru has dreams of opening a big shop selling fruits, vegetables, and other dry foodstuffs. She will share this loan with her loan group, "KARIBU VIEW," which consists of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Venusta is a mother of three children who are still at school. She is in her mid-30s and married. For four years now, Venusta has run a genge-duka shop, selling fruits, vegetables and other dry foodstuffs. She does business from 7am to 9pm every workday, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more genge stock to resell. Venusta has paid back the earlier loan successfully. She used her business profit to cover school fees and home food expenses and also saved to meet her business plan. With her new loan, she will buy dry food items for her business. Venusta dreams of making her family's life better. 

Venusta will share this loan with her loan group, " SARANGA," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy dry food items for her business.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha Isabel es una joven de 29 años de edad, que trabaja como supervisora de pista de una gasolinera, junto a su esposo procreo una hija que muy pronto entrara a estudiar, ella requiere el crédito para mejorar parte del techo de su vivienda y con el financiamiento comprara las láminas de zinc y perlines de esta manera ir garantizando poco a poco la seguridad en su hogar.
texts.en: Martha Isabel is a 29 year old woman who works as a supervisor at a gas station. Along with her husband she has a daughter who will be entering school soon. She needs the loan to improve part of the roof of their home and with the financing buy zinc sheet metal and purlins (structural roof lumber) and in this way slowly improve the safety of their home.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheet metal and purlins.

loans.name: Gul

texts.en: Gul is 29 years old. She is divorced and has a little child who is two years old. Gul is the only caretaker of her child, and she needs financial support. She is going to organize new business selling children's and women's clothes. With this aim she took part in a course, called "To Get Ahead," from a women's organization and earned a certificate. Gul will sell clothes in a local market. She will manage the business alone. She hopes that her business will go well and she will make a good income. Gul is requesting a loan of 5000 Tajikistani Somoni (TJS) to buy clothes for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes in order to open a clothing-sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima cálido que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora y cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, su esposo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, María ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Buenos Aires, a community with a warm climate whose people work in farming, retail and raising livestock. The community is located in the province of Morropon that belongs to the region of Piura along the northern coast of Peru. 

She makes a living selling chicha (a traditional corn-based alcoholic drink) and beer. Her business is located at her home. Her husband makes a living offering public transportation in his own motorcycle taxi. Maria has requested this loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to buy a large quantity of beer to offer her customers so that she can generate greater earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quanity of beers to offer her customers.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used buy more fruits and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arceli hopes that her business will last longer, and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para la compa de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera tener una producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Félix is 62 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Zaña district, a community located near the Jequetepeque river valley, which has permitted him to build his business, which is farming, commercial business, and livestock. He is located in the Chiclayo province of Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He raises and sells livestock. His business is located behind his home. He seeks a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy balanced animal feed to fatten his animals and in this way had product to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to buy the materials needed in his tailoring business. His loan also helped in the education of his children while his income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

He would now like to apply for an 11,000 PHP loan to buy raw materials like thread, fabric and other things needed in his tailoring business. His profits from the business will definitely help cover his daily needs and his children’s education. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Sandy dreams of having an additional sewing machine and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. He finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like thread, fabric and other things needed in his tailoring business.

loans.name: Bibian

texts.en: Bibian is a twenty-nine-year-old single woman with three children of whom two go to school. They live in  Kasese, Uganda. Bibian deals in cosmetics, working six days a week and eleven hours a day. Her business is located in town. Bibian is requesting for a loan to buy cosmetics and hopes to expand her business, however, competition is the challenge she faces.  Bibian is a hardworking woman and appreciates the services being offered.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman and with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Monica has operated a cafe business making stables like rice, tea, beans, chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality  as a major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, onions, and cooking oil for the business.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, onions, and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new  motorcycle spare parts and sell them

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta 6 grado,  tiene 3 hijos una hija de 19 años otra de 16 años y un hijo de 13 años.  Actualmente los 3 están estudiando.

Juan trabaja como vendedor de una reconocida comercial de muebles tiene 3 años de trabajar para ellos, anteriormente trabajo para otra empresa del mismo rubro. Además,  en su tiempo libre trabaja como albañil el mismo se encargara de realizar el trabajo en su vivienda .En su empleo formal su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 am hasta 4:00 pm

El dinero lo utilizara para mejorar su vivienda comprando los siguientes materiales  cemento, arena , ladrillos y hierro. Mejorando asi la calidad de su vivienda y de vida de su familia.    

Su principal sueño con su esposa es brindarle una buena educación a sus 3 hijos para que en el futuro sean personas de bien para la sociedad y brindarle una buena casa para seguridad familiar.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 years old, completed the 6th grade, and has 3 children. One daughter is 19, another 16, and a 13 year old son. Today the 3 are in school. Juan has worked as a well-known furniture vendor for 3 years, previously he worked for another business in the same area. In addition, in his free time he works as a brick layer and he himself with do the work on his home. In his regular job he works from 8 AM until 4 PM. He will use the money to improve his home by buying the following materials: cement, sand, bricks, and iron. This will improve the quality of his home and quality of life for his family.

His main dream, along with his wife, is to provide a good education to his 3 children so that in the future they can be people that contribute to society and provide a good house for his family's safety.

loans.use: to improve his home by buying materials such as cement, sand, bricks, and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to be able to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Dúo Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
Dúo Rios de Agua Viva
Este grupo formado por Eva Olivia, quien es soltera, y es dueña de una tienda ubicada en el municipio de San Raymundo hace 2 años también vende helados y choco frutas y está solicitando este crédito porque necesita comprar, algunos artículos de consumo diario como maíz, frijol, arroz, aceite, aguas, sopas instantáneas, condimentos para comida, también golosinas, quiere ampliar porque gracias a Dios tiene bastante clientela y necesita surtir un poco mas, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en: The group "Dúo Rios de Agua Viva" was formed by Eva Olivia, who is single and as of two years ago is the owner of a store located in the San Raymundo municipality. She also sells ice cream and chocolate covered fruit. She seeks this loan because she needs to buy some food items that are daily staples such as corn, beans, rice, oil, water, instant soups, condiments, and candy. She wants to expand, and thanks be to God she has quite a few customers and needs to stock up a little more. She hopes that you all can help with the loan.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Gloria has been working hard to manage her clothing shop.

To help expand her business, Gloria has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Gloria to generate greater profits and increase her business. Gloria hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business further. 

Gloria is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gloria who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Medius

texts.en:
Medius is 46 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Medius has been working hard to manage her timber business, where she sells timber. 

To help expand her business, Medius has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy timber, and will help Medius to generate greater profits and increase her working capital. Medius hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Medius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Medius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Rafael Ernesto

texts.es: Rafael tiene 51 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes en casa de su propiedad. Durante muchos años se ha dedicado a trabajar como soldador eléctrico en las diferentes zonas de su localidad y es así como se gana la vida y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Rafael no cuenta con el sistema de energía eléctrica por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica dentro de su vivienda y poder así gozar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael is 51 years old and lives in very modest conditions in a house that he owns. For many years, he has worked as a welder in different parts of his city and that is how he earns his living and maintains his household finances. 

Rafael does not have an electrical system, so he made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of electricity in his residence so that he can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to install electrical service in his house.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 36 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Hadija has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho (cornmeal), beans, cow peas, bread, sodas, juice and other items. 

To help expand her business, Hadija has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cow peas, bread, sodas, juice and other items, and will help Hadija to generate greater profits and improve their standard of living. Hadija hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Hadija is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hadija who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more  rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho (cornmeal), beans, cow peas, bread, sodas, juice and other items

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frio, abundante vegetación, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura y destilación de aguardiente, una bebida tradicional de la sierra norte del Perú, que se utiliza para días festivos, también se utiliza con fines curativos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de caña de azúcar para la elaboración de aguardiente y de esta manera generar mayor cantidad de aguardiente para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
René, age 54, lives with his wife and children in the Callayuc district.  It is a community with a cold climate and abundant vegetation.  The population there devotes itself to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  It is in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He devotes himself to agriculture and distilling brandy, a traditional drink in the northern highlands of Peru.  It is consumed at festivals and is also used for curative purposes.  

He has requested a loan for 3,000 soles to buy sugar cane in order to make brandy. This way he will generate a greater quantity of brandy to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane in order to make brandy.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is aged 32 and married to a construction worker and they are blessed with four children. Dolores owns and operates a transportation business doing motorcycle transport. She's been in this business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. 

Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. With the remaining money, she will purchase rice grains and hog feed to sell for additional income. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle, and purchase rice grains and hog feed to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-eight-year-old single woman with three children, of whom two go to school. She sells cassava flour on a busy street plus farming as additional income. Agnes  hopes to increase on her source of income by having a fully stocked cassava flour store, though lack of enough capital is a challenge she faces. Agnes is a hardworking woman who appreciates the services being offered and needs a loan to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fruit drinks, and other refreshing drinks

loans.name: Meresi

texts.en:
Meresi is a twenty-six-year-old married woman with three children, of whom two go to school. She  works six days a week and eleven hours a day, located on a busy street, plus farming as additional income. 

Meresi intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell and hopes to expand her business although competition and high license fees are challenges affecting her profitability expectations.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jairo es un hombre de 55 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos con una experiencia de más de 40 años en la agricultura ya que desde su niñez aprendió este oficio gracias a sus hijos. 
Su gran fortaleza es quizás su mayor debilidad ya que en su pueblo natal no hay muchos productores de leche por lo que las ventas son medianamente buenas, pero por la gran demanda por parte de sus clientes no puede satisfacerlos a todos, Don Jairo ha sabido salir adelante gracias a los préstamos realizados con la entidad colombiana. Jairo se ha quejado en reiteradas ocasiones del alto costo de los productos agrícolas y es por esta razón que un campesino no puede expandir su negocio, pues si no tiene un dinero ahorrado para afrontar los problemas climáticos y de plagas posiblemente le negocio quebré. Solicita un crédito para la compra de vacas lecheras con las que espera poder cubrir al cuota diaria de leche solicitada por sus clientes que necesitan de urgencia este producto y más sabiendo que el productor lechero más cercano está a kilómetros de su alcance
texts.en:
Jairo, 55, has 3 children. He has more than 40 years of experience in farming because he learned the trade from his parents since childhood. His biggest strength is maybe also his weakness: in his hometown there aren't many milk producers so his sales are good but due to the high demand, he can't meet his customers' needs. Jairo has managed to get ahead thanks to loans he has obtained from the field partner. Jairo has complained several times about the high price of farming supplies which prevent farmers from expanding their businesses because unless they have money saved to confront weather problems and plagues, their business will probably go bankrupt.
Jairo is asking for a loan to buy milking cows with which he hopes to meet the daily demand of milk from his customers, who need this product with urgency because the closest milking producer is kilometers away.

loans.use: to buy milking cows to meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Ana María De La Cruz

texts.es:
Ana de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre de una hija de 12 años estudia tercer grado en la escuela del barrio,  su esposo trabaja como seguridad para el puerto cutuco.

Ella cuenta con cinco años de vender frutas y verduras en el muelle de los coquitos, este negocio lo inicio por una amiga que vendía en esa zona y la motivo para que ella lo hiciera. El negocio está a una distancia de 20 minutos en bus desde su casa hasta el muelle, el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.

El dinero lo utilizara para comprar más fruta y verduras, para seguir vendiendo en ese lugar, el dinero le permitirá tener más variedad de frutas y verduras para ofrecer a sus clientes, la necesidad cubierta es de capital de trabajo. 


Su sueño principal es construir su casa, ya que ellos poseen un terrenos y ahí desean construir para tener su casa propia y brindarle a su hija un lugar seguro y también su sueño es seguir mejorando en  su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, studied up to third grade. She has a 12-year-old daughter who is now studying third grade in the neighborhood school. Ana's husband works as a security officer in the port of Cutuco. She has had a business selling fruits and vegetables in the pier of "los coquitos" for five years. She started this business because a friend had a business in that area and encouraged her to do the same. Ana's business is a 20-minute bus ride from her home to the dock and she works from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. She will use the money to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell there. The money will allow her to have a wider variety of fruit and vegetables to offer her customers. This will cover her working capital needs.
Ana's main dream is to build a house. They own some land and wish to build a house there in order to offer their daughter a safe place. She also dreams of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Beatrice has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer's in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Edith has been working hard to manage her clothing business, in which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy skirts, shirts, trousers, dresses, and blouses and will help Edith to generate greater profits and expand the business. Edith hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start up a second business. 

Edith is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Edith, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, trousers, dresses, and blouses.

loans.name: Dúo Angelica De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Angelica de San Pedro El grupo está a cargo de la señora Angelica quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general como champo, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, para damas caballeros y niños. También se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, pollo frito y chicharrones en la cuadra de su colonia.  Cuenta con la ayuda  incondicional de su esposo quien la apoya en todo.  El verano esta cerca y tiene mucha demanda de artículos para la playa como cremas para protegerse del sol, cremas para manos y cuerpo, y desea comprar un poco de yinas plásticas, que le han pedido, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por ello necesita hacer un préstamo para no quedarle mal a las personas que han confiado en ella para este verano.  Su sueño es tener una tienda grande y ofrecerles de todo a los vecinos ya que es una colonia que cada día necesita muchas cosas de consumo diario como también de vestir.
texts.en:
The "Angelica de San Pedro" duo is led by Señora Angelica, who earns her living selling cosmetics in general, like shampoos, lotions, creams, and deodorants for women, men, and children. She also sells french fries, fried chicken, and "chicharrones" [fried pork rind] on the street in her community. She has the unconditional help of her husband, who supports her in everything. 

Summer is very close, and Angelica has great demand for beach-related articles like sunscreen and hand and body cream, and she would like to buy some plastic sandals, which people are asking for, but she can't afford them with the money she has. That's why she needs to take out a loan so that she won't let down the people who are relying on her for this summer. Her dream is to have a large shop and sell a little of everything to her neighbors, as her community needs more and more everyday consumer goods and clothing items all the time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, plastic shoes, and food products to sell

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Gracias a KIVA MiCrèdito  Federico Jirón  logró abrir su propia pulpería en su comunidad. En ella ofrece una variedad de productos de consumo diario, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y queso que son los productos más solicitados por sus clientes. Su meta es continuar aumentando ese ritmo de ventas, con precios económicos y accesibles para todos los visitantes. Su esposa es un pilar esencial porque le ha brindado su apoyo desde que inició. 
Federico solicitó otro financiamiento en KIVA MiCrédito, para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y queso y otros nuevos (golosinas y gaseosas). Su propósito es lograr abastecer a toda su comunidad y más allá de ella  si es posible. Aunque tenga competencia, sus clientes siempre lo preferirán por la amplia variedad de productos que ofrece. Todas las ganancias serán a beneficio  de sus hijos, porque sueña con construirles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Thanks to Kiva and MiCrédito, Federico Jirón was able to open his own store within his community. In the store he offers a variety of daily consumption products including rice, beans, sugar, oil and cheese that are the products his customers ask for the most. His goal is to continue increasing the rhythm of his sales with affordable prices for all his visitors. His wife is an essential pillar to his business because she has provided her support since the beginning. 

Federico requested this additional financing from Kiva and MiCrédito for the purchase of products including rice, beans, sugar, oil, and cheese, as well as other new products like snacks and soft drinks. His goal is to provide enough goods for his community, and beyond, if possible. Although he has competition, his customers always choose him for the wide variety of products that he offers. All of his earnings will go to the benefit of his children because he dreams of building them a better future.

loans.use: to buy products including rice, beans, sugar, oil, cheese and new products including snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Eber Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a LA Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, tiene una tienda ubicada en su domicilio, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos como arroz, aceite, cereales y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio para ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos para sus clientes.
texts.en: Alfredo, 34, lives with his wife and children in the district of Zaña, where the population works in farming, livestock and commerce. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru. Alfredo sells groceries in a store in his home and his wife helps him. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy a variety of products such as rice, oil and cereals to make his business grow and offer his customers a larger amount of products.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as rice, oil and cereals to make his business grow.

loans.name: Gs La Cuesta # 2 Group

texts.es:
La joven  Egla  Orbelina  de 24  años de edad , vive con su conyugue en su casa de habitación, no tiene  hijos que dependen de ella, radica en la comunidad de la cuesta , San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras,  no tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 02  años  a la venta de ropa usada, su venta es de forma ambulante en las comunidades aledaña a su domicilio.
Egla es la líder del grupo solidario La Cuesta # 2 está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blusas, pantalones, chores y ropa de niño, con el apoyo del crédito ella pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Al igual que sus demás compañeros las señora Ritza que vende abarrotería en su negocio ubicado en su casa, Doña Durqui se dedica a la venta de tortillas y el señor Eliodoro que se dedica a la venta de detergentes, leña y hace viajes en su vehículo.
El sueño de doña Egla es mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Egla Orbelina is 24 years old, lives with her partner in a rented home. They don't have any children, and live in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras. She doesn't have her own house and for the past two years has been selling used clothing. Her sales are as a street vendor in the neighboring communities surrounding her home.

Elga is the leader of the "La Cuesta #2" group and is seeking a loan to buy blouses, pants, and children's clothing. With the support of the loan she plans on improving her business and her quality of life.

Like her colleagues, Ritza sells groceries and her business is located in her home. Durqui sells tortillas and Eliodoro sells detergents, wood, and runs errands in his vehicle.

Elga's dream is to improve her business and build a home.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2014.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, and children's clothing for her business.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a 33-year old-woman. She is single but has one child who attends school. She buys and sells cows and also works at the District Local government as a stenographic secretary. She started her business fattening cattle in 2010 so that she could be able to get income to take care of her family's needs. 

Her major clients are mainly the local community because her business is on a small scale. She will use the loan to buy more cows for fattening. Her dream is to expand her business to a large scale; her major challenge is lack of enough capital to buy in bulk when she could have made more profits. Loyce is thankful to Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial support rendered to her and she encourages fellow women to engage themselves in income generating activities.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Doris Cecilia

texts.es: Doris de 54 años de edad, es una mujer casada dedicada al comercio de ropa, calzado, cosmético y perfumería. Su experiencia data desde hace 17 años, cuando por la necesidad de mejorar  los ingresos  acudió al comercio como su principal  actividad y fuente de bienestar  familiar.  Los productos de su oferta son la ropa, el calzado, los cosméticos, perfumería, y variedades.  Sus ventas las realizan a crédito y respondiendo a pedidos en un horario correspondiente a 6 horas diarias, mediante el cual promociona ante su vecindad artículos como calzado, cosméticos,  etc, que compra a mayoristas para venderlo a un buen precio. Doris ha recibido 3 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual se ha fortalecido el capital de trabajo, sus ventas y sus utilidades.  Las metas de su negocio están asociadas a la consolidación de sus ventas para lograr mejorara sus ingresos familiares  y su mayor desafío es tener el recurso financiero necesario para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará  ropa, calzado, perfumería, cosméticos lencería y variedades, con ello tendrá un fondo capital para fortalecer sus inventarios sus ventas y ganar mucho más.
texts.en:
Doris is 54 years old and is married. She works selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics and perfumes. 17 years ago, in need of improving her income, she chose commerce as her main activity and source of family well-being. She makes her sales on credit and under sales order, working for 6 hours everyday. She advertises articles such as shoes, cosmetics, etc in her neighborhood which she buys wholesale in order to offer good prices.
Doris has received financing from the field partner, Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, on three occasions. This has strengthened her working capital, sales and utilities. Her business goals are to consolidate her sales in order to improve her family's income. Her biggest challenge is to have the financial resources to do so. She is applying for a loan from Kiva with which she will buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, underwear and other items. This will allow her to have a capital fund to strengthen her inventory, her sales and make more money.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, underwear and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa Angélica tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza, y piqueos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, su esposo le apoya en esta labor, también se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz amarillo apoyándole con las ventas, tiene una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Angélica is 28 years old. She lives with her husband in the La Matanza district, a community which has a hot climate. Its population works in agriculture, business, and ranching. It is located in the Morropon province, which is part of the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

She sells chicha de jora (a traditional corn liquor), beer, and snacks. Her business is located in her house. Her husband helps her with this work and also buys and sells yellow corn, helping her with the sales. They have a united family. She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy a greater quantity of beer and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to her coffee crops and keep them clean

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es: Esta historia deja saber ese pensamiento a un ortodoxo que tenemos en el siglo 21, de como un machismo puede marcar tanto a una persona, ella es Adriana una mujer ya madura de 28 años de edad que ha sido muy marginada pues no aceptan que sea una agricultura, dicen que ese trabajo es para hombres. Adriana se levanta en la madrugada para cuidar y darle mantenimiento a su cultivo, quiere demostrar que una mujer si realiza los trabajos de campo a cabalidad que no importa el sexo, que cualquier persona que ama su trabajo puede desempeñar cualquier función por esta razón solicita un crédito para fortalecer su establecimiento y con el comprar insumos, semillas para darle variedad a su cultivo, fungicidas, exterminadores y adecuar su cultivo para soportar el fuerte invierno y así cumplir su sueño ser una mujer sobresaliente en su labor, una campesina dueña de un próspero cultivo.
texts.en:
This story is about the traditional thoughts that exist in the 21st century.  It is about how chauvinism is able leave such a mark on a person.  She is Adriana, a mature 28 year old woman.  She has been very marginalized because they do not accept that she is a farmer.  They say that this work is for men.

Adriana gets up at daybreak to take care of and perform maintenance on her crop.  She wants to show that a woman capably does the work in the field, and that sex does not matter.  Any person who loves their work is able to carry out any function.

For this reason she is requesting a loan to strengthen her establishment.  She will use the loan to buy supplies and seeds for a variety of crops.  She will buy fungicides and pesticides, and she will care for her crops in order to withstand the strong winter.  This way she will fulfill her dream of being a woman who is successful in her work, a countrywoman who is the owner of a prosperous crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Fredis  Enrique

texts.es: Fredis  de 42 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 2  14 años, Fredis  para sostener su hogar genera ingresos mediante su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, el cual inició desde hace 8 años, después de haber trabajado en una panadería y aprender y entusiasmado por el negocio de su vecino, dedicado también a este oficio. Los principales productos son las frituras, perros calientes, salchichas y papas revueltas, pizzas etc. Que vende en un punto fijo que se encuentra comercialmente bien ubicado. Sus ventas las realiza de contado en horarios de 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la mañana y de 2 a 10 de la noche. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es hacer crecer su clientela y tener un local propio, para abordar un mercado mucho más amplio. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos en volúmenes como harina y carnes, con los cuales tendría una mayor producción y así, mismo una mayor ganancia. Su meta a mediano plazo es tener su propia casa, por eso trabaja persistentemente para lograr este, su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en: Fredis is 42 years old and lives in Baranquilla city with his wife and 4 children, ages 2 to 14 years old. Fredis supports his home generating income by selling fast food, a business he began 8 years ago.
