After having worked in a bakery, learning and enthused by his neighbor's business, he decided to enter this business as well. The main products are french fries, hot dogs, sausages, pizzas, etc. that he sells at the same well-located locale. He sells from 8-10 in the morning and 2-10 at night. Today his primary goal is to grow his customers and have his own larger locale near a market. Today he is applying for a loan, his first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy ingredients in bulk such as flour and meat, so he can have greater production and thus greater profit. His goal is to have his own home, so he is working constantly to achieve this, and his dream is to be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of flour and meat.

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es: Jorge tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, hija de nueve años y su hijo de un año de edad. Jorge tiene 19 años de dedicarse al comercio de plátanos en el mercado central de su localidad y es así como por mucho tiempo ha llevado y sigue llevando el sustento a su hogar. Jorge desea dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su vivienda dado que no cuenta con el servicio.
texts.en: Jorge is 43 years old and lives in his own house, together with his partner, a nine-year-old daughter and a son one year old. Jorge has been working for 19 years selling bananas in the central market of his locality, and this is how he has supported and continues to support his household. Jorge wants to give his family better living conditions, so he has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of electricity in his house, since he currently does not have it.

loans.use: to install electricity service

loans.name: Maria Candida

texts.es:
María, tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, cuatro hijos y tres nietos, se negocio consiste en venta de ropa, nace por entusiasmo propio y como una manera de generar ingresos para aportar en los gastos de su hogar, trabaja de siete de la mañana a dos y media de la tarde, por el momento su negocio cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes.
Utilizara el crédito para surtir el inventario de su negocio con variedad de prendas que le permitan satisfacer a sus clientes comprara chores, blusas, camisas, ropa interior ambos sexos, camisetas, faldas, pantalones, etc., espera atraer nuevos clientes aumentar sus ventas e ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Su objetivo es continuar trabajando día con día para mejorar la situación económica y enseñar a sus nietos a administrar bien un negocio.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old. She lives with her husband, four children, and three grandchildren. Her business consists of selling clothing. It was born of her own enthusiasm and as a way to generate income to contribute to the household expenses. She works from seven in the morning to two-thirty in the afternoon. For now, her business has a large clientele.

María will use the loan to stock up the inventory of her business with a variety of garments that will allow her to satisfy her customers. She will buy shorts, blouses, shirts, underwear for both sexes, t-shirts, skirts, pants, etc. She hopes to attract new customers and to increase her sales and income in order to improve her family's quality of life.

Her objective is to continue working day after day to improve her financial situation and teach her grandchildren to run a business well.

loans.use: to buy shorts, blouses, shirts, underwear for both sexes, t-shirts, skirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Segundo Victor

texts.es:
Segundo Víctor tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la albañilería, desempeñándose como albañil y maestro de construcción civil en la construcción de viviendas, paredes entre otras, tiene una familia unida su esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral patos, pavos, cuyes, Segundo ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de útiles escolares y de esta manera brindarle las facilidades a su hijo para que estudie.
texts.en:
Segundo, 38, lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotun, a community with varied climate where the population works in farming, livestock and commerce. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru.
Segundo works as a construction worker and master builder in the construction of homes or walls among others. He has a close-knit family. His wife works breeding poultry such as ducks, turkeys and guinea pigs.
Segundo is asking for a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy school supplies to help his son in his studies.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to and clean her coffee crops

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: Los diseños y estilos de las joyas elaboradas en plata de Gerardo tienen mucha demanda por sus  finos  y delicados  acabados. Cada prenda  denota una belleza única y especial  elaborada con unas manos llenas de inspiración y creatividad. Unos de los principales propósito de Gerardo es contar con  una mayor cantidad  de materia prima, por lo que solicita un financiamiento  en KIVA MiCrédito para la compra de materia prima (plata 925) y elaborar sus joyas. Este préstamo le ayudará  a cumplir con todos los encargos de sus clientes fieles y nuevos,  que lo visitan en su joyería. Las ganancias serán destinadas para beneficio de su familia, y para seguir ampliando su negocio, que es su más grande anhelo.
texts.en: The designs and styles of jewelry made in silver made by Gerardo are much in demand for their fine, delicate finishes.  Each piece denotes a unique, beautiful piece special made with hands full of inspiration and creativity.  One of Gerardo’s main goals is to have a greater quantity of raw materials and so, he is requesting a loan with Kiva through MiCrédito for the purchase of Silver 925 to design his jewelry.  This loan will help him fill all the orders of his customers, both loyal and new, that visit his jeweler’s shop.  The profits will go to benefit his family, and to continue growing his business, which is his greatest dream.

loans.use: to purchase raw material (Silver 925).

loans.name: Alfredo Enrique

texts.es:
Don Alfredo de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, tiene una hija de 7 años de edad, estudia primer grado y es empleado del puerto  cutuco.  

Don Alfredo es empleado, pero desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura. Este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, el lugar donde cultiva está a 15 minutos de su casa y el trabajo lo realiza en sus días libres de 6: am a 12: pm.
    
El dinero lo utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para su cultivo de maíz. Para asegurar la alimentación a su familia.

Su sueño principalmente es jubilarse y brindarle la educación necesaria a su hija para que pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria y pueda encontrar un buen empleo.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 50, studied until 6th grade. He has a 7-year-old daughter who studies first grade. He is an employee at the port of Cutuco but from an early age he has worked in farming. He learned the trade from his father. The land where he works is 15 minutes from his home and he works on his free days from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m.
Alfredo will use the money to buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his corn crops in order to ensure the food for his family. His main dream is to retire and to be able to offer his daughter the education necessary for her to go to college and find a good job.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his corn crops.

loans.name: Dúo Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Dúo SANTA TERESITA 
La señora Evelin Amalia es madre de 2 hijos es propietaria de una venta de artículos de plasticos de tupper ubicada en el sector de la zona 9 santa teresita. La venta de tupper que ella administra tiene 18 años de tenerla cuando ella empezó a administrarla era muy pequeña pero con la ayuda de Dios ella le ha dado una buena administración y ha logrado crecerla aun más. le beneficia porque vende al mayor y a sus clientes le puede dar un mejor servicio. tiene sueños y metas muy grandes ella quiere que su negocio sede a conocer mucho más en los mercados y brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos tuper.
texts.en:
Santa Teresita Duo

Evelin Amalia is the mother of 2 children. She is the owner of a business selling Tupperware plastic items located in Santa Teresita in zone 9 of the city. She has had the Tupperware business for 18 years. When she started it was very small, but with the help of God she has managed it well and has succeeded in growing it even more. She benefits because she sells wholesale and she can give her customers better service. She has very big dreams and goals. She wants her business to be much more well-known in the markets, and she wants to give her children a better education. She is asking for this loan in order to buy more merchandise in the form of Tupperware products.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products to sell

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es: Blanca es una señora que le gusta salir adelante con su propio esfuerzo, ella se dedica a la agricultura, a trabajar al diario y a criar animales menores, comenta que su esposo no la deja trabajar pero que erlla se va al jornal a escondidas de él. Blanca vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos que ya no viven con ella, comenta que en su mayoria es ella la que sacó adelante a sus hijos mientras que estaban a su lado, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. El credito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus cultivos, Blanca es socia de un grupo de mujeres en su que lo formaron en el sector en el que vive. Lo que Blanca aspira es seguir adelante con sus cultivos y aunque sus hijos ya seasn casados quiere apoyarles para queterminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Blanca likes to get ahead through her own effort. She works as a farmer daily and also breeds small animals. She says her husband doesn't let her work but she sneaks out behind his back. Blanca lives with her husband and has two children who no longer live with her. She was mostly responsible for bringing up her children while they were living with her. Her husband works as a farmer.
Blanca is going to invest the money in the purchase of manure for her crops. She is a member of a group of women that was created in the area where she lives. Blanca's goal is to continue with her crops and although her children are already married, she wants to support them so they will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase manure.

loans.name: Dilmer

texts.es:
Dilmer tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Visa del Distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima variado, abundante vegetación, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz amarillo duro criollo; cultiva 2 has en su terreno, también se dedica a la ganadería, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compa de una ternera y posteriormente aprovechar la leche fresca para vender a sus vecinos y moradores de su caserío.
texts.en: Dilmer is 25 years old, and lives with his wife and children in the in the village of Visa, in the Santo Tomás district, located in Cutervo province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in Peru’s northern sierra.  It is a community of varied climate and abundant vegetation, and the population is engaged in farming, business, and cattle-raising.  Dilmer is engaged in farming, especially the cultivation of hard yellow Creole corn.  He farms two hectares on his land, and he also raises cattle.  He is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of a calf, and will later take advantage of the fresh milk to sell to his neighbors and residents of his village.

loans.use: to purchase a calf in order to sell the fresh milk to his neighbors and residents of his village.

loans.name: Flor Isabel

texts.es:
Flor de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado. Vive con su papá, tiene una niña de 6 años, actualmente está soltera su hija ya asiste a la escuela y estudia parvularia, a pesar que vive con sus padres solo su hija depende de ella.
 
Antes vendía ropa, pero entro a trabajar a una empresa donde laboro por 3 años, actualmente se dedica nuevamente a la venta de ropa, casa por casa en su comunidad y comunidades vecinas, su horario de trabajo inicia desde las 8: am hasta la tarde que regresa a su casa. 
   
El dinero lo utilizara para la compra de más ropa, entre ellas faldas, blusas, ropa para niños y ropa interior para mujeres, la necesidad a cubrir es de capital de inversión para su negocio.  

Sus planes a futuro es formar un hogar y brindarle a su hija una familia y con respecto al negocio seguir mejorando y obteniendo nuevos clientes para seguir creciendo en las ventas por ende los ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Flor is 23 years old, and she has studied up to the eighth grade. She lives with her father, and she has a little girl who is 6 years old. Currently, she is single, and her daughter is already studying in nursery school. Although she lives with her parents, her daughter is her only dependent. 

She used to sell clothing, but she went to work for a company where she stayed for three years. She is currently selling clothing again, going house to house in her community and in neighboring communities. Her work schedule begins at 8:00 a.m. and ends in the afternoon when she returns to her house.

She will use the money for the purchase of more clothing such as skirts, blouses, children’s clothing and women’s undergarments; and to meet the need for capital to invest in her business.

Her future plans are to make a home and give her daughter a family; and with respect to the business, to continue improving and gaining new customers in order to continue increasing her sales, and therefore, her income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing such as skirts, blouses, children's clothing, and women's undergarments.

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Бозоргул предприимчивая женщина, заботящаяся о благосостоянии семьи. Она 50-летняя разведенная женщина с тремя детьми. В данный момент она живет у сестры в районе Хамадони. Бозоргул нигде не работает, но она планирует начать свой маленький бизнес. Ее интересует продажа мороженного, так как уже погода потеплело и начался сезон продажи мороженного. Бозоргул имеет сбережение в размере 80 долларов, еще недостающую сумму она просит в кредит. Бозоргул намеревается приобрести аппарат мороженного и начать продажу. Она считает, что сейчас это прибыльный бизнес. Бозоргул надеется, что ей дадут шанс начать зарабатывать, так как у нее нет другой поддержки.
texts.en: Bozorgul is an enterprising woman who takes good care of her family. She is a 50 year old woman with three children. She currently lives with her sister in the Khamadoni district. Bozorgul has never had a job, but she is planning to start a small business. She is interested in selling ice cream because the weather is getting warmer and it is the season for ice cream. Bozorgul has $80 saved, but will need to take out a loan to buy an ice cream machine and start selling. She thinks that it will be a profitable business and hopes that she will have a chance to start earning money because she has no other support.

loans.use: to buy an ice cream machine and start a business

loans.name: Fotimakhon

texts.ru:
Фотимахон замужняя женщина. Ей 39 лет. Она с дочкой и сестрой живет в городе Душанбе. Муж Фотимахон находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, как и большинство мужчин Республики. У Фотимахон единственная дочь. Ей 10 лет. Она учится в школе. 
   Фотимахон около трех лет занимается предоставлением услуги шитья национальной одежды. Она шить начала после окончания школы, но только 3 года назад она использовала свой талант в доходной деятельности. Она любит свою работу и хочет далее продолжить работать в этом направлении. Но у нее сейчас возникли проблемы со швейной машинкой. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Она на заемные деньги купить швейную машинку.
texts.en:
Fotimakhon is 39, married and lives in Dushanbe with her daughter and sister. Her husband works in Russia like many men in Tajikistan. Her daughter is 10 and goes to school.

Fotimakhon has been sewing traditional clothing as a business for about three years. She began sewing after finishing school, but it was only three years ago that she started earning money from sewing. She loves her work and wants to continue, but she is having problems with her sewing machine. This is why she has applied for a loan. She is borrowing the money to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Meivy

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Meivy con su anterir credikiva, con el cual compró cervezas al por mayor y de contado y las vendió pudiendo atender los pedidos de su clientela. Con su credikiva fortaleció su capital de trabajo, aumentó sus ventas y las utilidades del negocio. Desde que recibió su credikiva ha ido mejorando paulatinamente sus ingresos familiares y en el negocio. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva : " Muchas gracias por apoyarme, para seguir progresando en mi negocio. "  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo fianciamiento, mediante el cual comprará cervezas y mercancias como ropa, calzado y accesorios, sobre pedidos, que han hecho sus clientes , pues cada dia tiene mas clientela fija que se acerca a su punto comercial, especialmente en las fechas especiales, como la que está por venir mediante la cual se celebra : "El dia de la madre".
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Meivy with her previous Kiva loan.  It allowed her to buy beer in bulk and with cash, and she sold it, filling her customers' orders.  With her Kiva loan she increased her working capital, her sales, and her profit.  Since receiving her Kiva loan, she has been gradually increasing her family and business income.  Meivy sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much for supporting me so I can continue to progress in my business."  She is currently applying for a new loan, by means of which she will buy beer and other merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and accessories to have in stock in addition to her customers' orders.  An increasing number of regular customers are visiting her place of business every day, especially with special occasions such as Mother's Day approaching.

loans.use: to buy beer and other merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and accessories

loans.name: Fidel Alberto

texts.es:
Fidel, manifiesta que su negocio ha crecido, su rentabilidad es mayor, lo que le respalda el pago de de su deuda y el estilo de vida familiar ha cambiado, esto es posible a la buena inversión del crédito anterior.
En esta oportunidad requiere de más capital para invertirlo en la compra de bujías, cables, pastillas para frenos, espejos, interruptores, sensores, aceite, que le permitan tener los accesorios necesarios  para brindar un buen servicio a los clientes y dar mantenimiento a su vehículo propio en el que realiza sus viajes.
.
texts.en:
Fidel states that his business has grown, and his profits are higher, which supports the payment of his debt.  In addition, his family’s lifestyle has changed, and this is possible due to the good investment of his previous loan.  At this time, he requires more capital to invest in the purchase of spark plugs, cables, brake pads, mirrors, switches, sensors, and oil.  This will allow him to have the necessary spare parts to provide good service to his customers and maintain his own vehicle in which he makes his trips.
.

loans.use: to purchase spark plugs, cables, brake pads, mirrors, switches, sensors, and oil.

loans.name: Mairenia

texts.es:
Mairenia de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada su esposo esta fuera del país, ella  vive actualmente con la familia de su esposo tiene un hijo de cuatro años que aún no asiste a la escuela

Actualmente ello no tiene un negocio propio sus ingresos provienen de las remesas de su esposo, ella anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa atunera, pero por problemas de salud se operó la vista y se ha retirado de trabajar momentáneamente.

El dinero lo utilizaran para seguir con la construcción de su casa, para comprar cemento, arena, grava, hierro y para cancelar la mano de obra y poner el piso a la vivienda.


Su sueño principal es terminar la construcción de su casa, para trasladase a vivir ahí y brindarle un buen hogar  a su hijo y dentro de los planes a futuro de ellos es montar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Mairenia, 23  years old, studied until the fourth grade.  She is married and her husband is living outside of the country. She is currently living with her husband’s family and has a four year old son who does not yet attend school.

At present, she does not have her own business and her income stems from the remittances sent by her husband. Formerly, she was working for a tuna packing business, however, due to health problems she had to have an eye operation and she has withdrawn from the labor force for the time being.

She will use the money to continue construction on her house and buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron bars and to pay labor costs. She wants to install a floor in her home.

Her principal dream is finish the construction on her house so that she can move into it and provide a good home for her son. Among her plans for the future is the desire to start her own business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel and iron bars and to pay labor costs to install a floor in her house.

loans.name: Pedro Romel

texts.es: El señor pedro tiene 54 años, el vive con sus  2 sobrinas y su  tio, ya que sus padres es tan muertos , a dedicado todad su vidad  a la ganaderia  por mucho tiempo  esta actividad a sido su principal fuente de ingresos ,con su anterior prestamo pudo sobresalir en su negocio y ahora con un nuevo credito renovado que fodemi le ha dado  planea  hacer una nueva compra de ganado con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos, el señor pedro durante la vigencia del anterior credito demostro mucha responsabilidad en cuanto a sus obligaciones, en su  negocio le va muy bien , es bastante rentable, su aspiracion mas grande es de poder incrementar su negocio y para  asi poder  darse una vida digna.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro is 54 years old and lives with two nieces and an uncle. His parents have been deceased for some time. Pedro has devoted his entire life to raising livestock and spends a large amount of time in this activity since it is his main source of income.

His previous loan allowed him to move forward with his business and now he wants to obtain a new loan from FODEMI because he plans to purchase another cow so that he can increase his earnings. Throughout the term of his previous loan, Sr. Pedro demonstrated a great deal of responsibility in handling his obligations. His business is doing very well and is quite profitable. His larger ambition is to increase his business so that he can have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lilian Ester

texts.es:
La joven Lilian  de 25  años de edad, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su conyugue y tiene casa propia, radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 03 años  al negocio de venta de ropa interior como calcetas, bikinis, pantalones y blusas, ella vende con los empleados de la camaronera donde ella trabaja.
Lilian es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante ya hizo su casa  la empezó a construir con el dinero que Prisma y Kiva le apoyaron,  Lilian actualmente está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma y Kiva.
Lilian está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de pantalones, sandalias, bracieres, biquinis, bóxer, calcetas y camisas blancas, con el apoyo de este crédito ella desea mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando en su negocio para así tener mejores ganancias. Su sueño es ir mejorando su casa para vivir mejor.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014
texts.en: Lilian is 25 years old and has two dependent children.  She lives with her husband and owns her house.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, Valle in the south of Honduras.  For three years she has been selling undergarments such as socks, bikinis, pants, and blouses.  She sells to employees of the shrimp boat where she works.  Lilian is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead in life.  She already has a house.  She started building it with financial support from Prisma and Kiva.  Lilian is now very happy about working with Prisma and Kiva.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, sandals, bras, bikinis, boxers, socks, and white shirts.  With the support from this loan she hopes to increase her income and continue working at her business so she can increase her earnings.  Her dream is to continue improving her house she she can live better.

loans.use: to buy pants, sandals, bras, bikinis, boxers, socks, and white shirts for her business

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru:
Майсара из города Душанбе планирует начать собственное швейное дело. Она опытная и умелая швея. Ей 49 лет. Ее муж работает поваром. У них четверо детей, которые учатся и работают. 
Майсара по характеру целеустремленная женщина. Она поставила перед собой цель открыть свое швейное дело и уже арендовала помещение в ателье. Теперь на заемные средства она хочет приобрести компьютерную швейную машинку и другие принадлежности для шитья. По ее словам ее первыми клиентами будут родные, знакомые, друзья и соседи. Майсара верит в успех своего дела, так как услуга швеи всегда востребована в городе.
texts.en:
Maysara is from Dushanbe and is planning to start her own sewing business. She is a skilled and experienced seamstress. She is 49 and her husband works as a cook. They have four children who are either working or in school. 

Maysara is a determined woman by nature. She set herself the goal of starting a sewing business and has already leased a workspace. Now she wants to borrow money to buy a computerized sewing machine and other supplies. She says that her first customers will be her relatives, friends, acquaintances and neighbors. Maysara believes that she will be successful because there is always demand for seamstresses in the city.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine and other supplies to start a sewing business

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 31 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past eight years, Allen has been working hard to manage her grocery, which sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, juice, detergent, bread, sodas and other items.

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, juice, detergent, bread, sodas and other items, and will help Allen to generate greater profits and start up another business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

Allen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, juice, detergent, bread, sodas and other items

loans.name: Evelin Judith

texts.es: Evelin tiene 41 años de edad y reside en vivienda propia junto a sus dos hijas de 10 años, 20 años y su hijo de 17 años de edad. Evelin es muy trabajadora y luchadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de prendas de vestir desde hace 20 años. Evelin desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales dado que no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica y desea dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones para su desarrollo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Evelin is 41 years old and lives in a house she owns with her two daughters, who are 10 and 20 years of age, and her son, who is 17 years old. Evelin is very hard working and is doing everything within her power to provide her family with a better standard of living. She has been selling a variety of articles of clothing for 20 years.

Evelin wants to improve her living conditions since she does not have electricity and she wants to provide better conditions for her children for their development. Consequently, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to install electricity as soon as possible.

loans.use: to install electrical services in her home.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es:
Angelita tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maíz, frejol, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y piqueos, junto a su esposo también se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, Angelita ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balaceados para engorde de los mismos y una segunda parte para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Angelita is 69 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in La Matanza district, located in Morropon province, which belongs to the Piura region on Peru’s northern coast.  The community is engaged in farming, (especially the cultivation of corn and beans), business, and cattle-raising.  Angelita is engaged in selling “chicha de jora” [a fermented beverage derived from corn], beer, and appetizers.  She is also engaged in raising small animals with her husband.  Angelita is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals, and the second part will be used to purchase more beer.  In this way, she will generate higher income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Provia

texts.en:
Provia is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Provia has been working hard to manage her bar/restaurant, which sells water, soda, beer and posho.

To help expand her business, Provia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soda, water, rice and beans, and will help Provia to generate greater profits and improve the family income. Provia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger hotel.

Provia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Provia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy soda, water, rice and beans

loans.name: Dúo Peña De Oro Group

texts.es:
DUO PEÑA DE ORO
La señora Vivian Isabel de 36 años, casada, desde hace 6 años posee un taller de artesanías ubicada en Colonia Santa Otilia Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña Vivian es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar productos para realizar sus artesanías.
texts.en:
DUO PEÑA DE ORO (GOLDEN CLUB PAIR)

Sra. Vivian Isabel is 36 years old and married.  For the past six years she has had a handicraft shop located in the Santa Otilia Colony in Chimaltenango. Based on her efforts, she succeeded in establishing and improving her home.  Through her business, she is supporting her family and helping it get ahead. 

Doña Vivian’s dream is to be able to improve her and her family’s quality of life through the micro credit she is requesting from FAPE; she wants to purchase materials to make her handicrafts with the loan.

loans.use: purchase materials to make imaginative bangels and chains.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Kabale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her saloon, which sells hair foods, braids and weaves. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids, relaxers, rollers and sprays, and will help Grace to generate greater profit and improve family well-being. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy braids, relaxers, rollers and sprays.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old. She lives in Trigos, Ozamiz. She is married and has five children. She is a widow.

Evangeline is a good mother to her children, and she is also a good member of PMPC. Snack vending is her source of income and she asked for a loan to buy ingredients for her snack vending.   Evangeline wants to have her children in school. 

Evangeline is a business-minded person and she wants to earn more for retirement.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Trigos, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories, and the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also sells fruits and vegetables for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ivy hopes to continuously expand her business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Mugusu B Abamwe Group

texts.en: Robert, a member of Mugusu B Abamwe group, is aged 48 and is living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling charcoal, alongside farming which has boosted his income. He is facing a challenge of high taxes, however, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas like town centers where there is high demand in order to increase his income. Robert needs another loan to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 49 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anecita is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Anecita has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from fish vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase beans, rice, and maize for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, and maize for her business

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with four school going children. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mesalim operates a hotel business where she makes various food like beans, rice, tea, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
Una combinación de amabilidad y atención de calidad es lo que reciben los clientes al entrar al nuevo negocio (pulpería) de María José,  dónde encuentran los productos ordenados y en buen estado para la preparación de la comida. Ella tiene la edad de 31 años, está casada, tiene un hijo y está a la espera de otro. Es una mujer trabajadora y excelente madre. Hace tres años inicio su negocio, su esposo es su principal apoyo, ambos trabajan para brindarle a su familia seguridad y educación. 
María solicita un segundo financiamiento para la compra de productos básicos, tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite y especias. Asegura que con el primer crédito para sus primer negocio diversifico sus productos y aumento su clientela, lo que motivo abrir su segundo negocio el cual le ha brindado estabilidad económica. Deposita su confianza en el segundo préstamo, puesto que su familia está creciendo, además desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Una mujer con visión de futuro nunca se rinde, afirma que seguirá trabajando hasta lograr tener una distribuidora de productos varios.
texts.en:
A combination of friendliness and attention to quality is what customers receive when entering María José's new business (a convenience store), where they find products for cooking that are well arranged and in good condition. She is 31 years old, married, has one child and is expecting another one. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent mother. She started her business three years ago. Her husband is her main support -- they both work to provide security and education to their family. 

María is requesting a second loan to buy basic foodstuffs, such as rice, beans, oil and spices. She maintains that with the first loan for her first business, she diversified her products and increased her clientele. This motivated her to open her second business, which has provided her with financial stability. She puts her trust in this second loan, as her family is growing. She also wants to better her living conditions. A woman with a vision for the future does not give up. She affirms that she will continue working until becoming a distributor of various products.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, such as rice, beans, oil and spices.

loans.name: Sevgül

texts.en:
Sevgül has three children.  For 22 years she has made oriental style dresses, a job she started through friends. She sews beads and stones on them and sells them to companies.  Thanks to this, she has been able to stand up straight through life.  

With this loan, she will be able to do more work and increase her sales.  She has worked selflessly for her family and is striving to maintain a comfortable life.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Sevgül  Hanım’ın 3 çocuğu var.  Arkadaşları sayesinde bu işe başlayan Sevgül Hanım 22 yıldır oryantal elbiseleri hazırlıyor.  Onları boncuk ve taşlarla işleyerek firmalara satıyor.  Bu sayede hayatta dimdik durabilen güçlü bir kadın.  Bu kredi ile daha çok iş yapmak ve satışlarını artırmak istiyor.  Şimdiye kadar ailesi için özverili bir şekilde çalışan Sevgül Hanım bundan sonra rahat bir hayat sürdürmek için çabalıyor.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Alexi Rodolfo

texts.es:
Alexi de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  tiene 2 hijos un niño de un año de edad y una niña de 6 años de edad ella está cursando primer grado.

Él por su parte era empleado en una empresa  y desde hace unos años se asoció con su tío para mejorar la pesca. Alexi  se va pescar muchas veces desde las 5 de la mañana hasta bien tarde otras jornada las hace de noche.

El dinero lo utilizaran para comprar hilo para tejer las redes, plomo y corcho para las nuevas redes;  el dinero les ayudara a mejorar su equipo de trabajo.    


Su sueño principal es preparar a sus hijos para que tengan un buen futuro, con el préstamo va a mejorar su equipo y por ende incrementar la pesca y sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Alexi is 29 years old and he has studied up to the ninth grade. He lives with his partner who takes care of the household duties, and he has two children—a boy who is one year old, and a girl who is 6 years old and studying in first grade.

He, for his part, used to work for a company; and a few years ago he joined his uncle in fishing in order to do better. Many times Alexi goes out to fish from 5 in the morning until very late; and on other days he works at night.

The money will be used for purchasing thread for weaving the nets, and lead and cork for the new nets; and for helping them improve their work equipment.

His main dream is to prepare his children so that they may have a good future. With the loan, he will improve his equipment and therefore, increase his catch and his income.

loans.use: to purchase thread for weaving the nets and lead and cork for the new nets; and to improve his working equipment.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, cowpeas, bread, sodas, juice and other items. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, cowpeas, bread, sodas, juice and other items, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and expand his business. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to add more stock to his business. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, cowpeas, bread, sodas and juice.

loans.name: Onesious

texts.en:
Onesious is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Kabale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past 11 years, Onesious has been working hard to manage his timber business, which sells timber.

To help expand his business, Onesious has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber and machines, and will help Onesious to generate greater profits and expand his market to wider coverage. Onesious hopes that in the future he will be able to stock more timber.

Onesious is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Onesious who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more timber

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 41 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Andrew has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Andrew has requested a loan of 3.000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Andrew to generate greater profits and expand the business. Andrew hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his capital. 

Andrew is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Andrew who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Wilber has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells cells, rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cow peas, bread, sodas, juice and other items.

To help expand his business, Wilber has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cells, rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cow peas, bread, sodas, juice and other items, and will help Wilber to generate greater profits and add more stock. Wilber hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

Wilber is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilber who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cells, rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cow peas, bread, sodas and juice

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Elison, who is a father of two sons who are at school, was born in the late 1970s somewhere in Tanzania. He is married and for eight years now he has been engaged in gengeduka, a business selling fruits and vegetables and other dry foodstuff (cooking oil, maize, baking flour, salt, and sugar). Elison works from 7 am to 10 pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Elison is requesting a third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With his two previous loans (both of which he paid back successfully) he bought popular often-demanded products for his shop. With the increased income, Elison paid school fees and household food expenses. He is also plowing back capital into his gengeduka. He dreams of expanding his business. Elison will use this loan to replenish his business with new stock. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "UNITY" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his business with new stock.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is 35 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Ismael has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cow peas, bread, sodas, juice and other items. 

To help expand his business, Ismael has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cow peas, bread, sodas, juice and other items, and will help Ismael to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Ismael hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Ismael is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ismael who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more  rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho (cornmeal), beans, cow peas, bread, sodas, juice and other items

loans.name: Gan-Erdene

texts.en:
Gan-Erdene is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children. His wife, Bolorchimeg, is 33 years old. She works as an assistant at Oriental clinic. His son, Ariunkhuu, is five years old. His daughter, Choimaa, is nine years old. The children attend the local primary school. 

Gan-Erdene has been working at a tire repair station. He is well experienced in this work. He is starting his own small tire repair service station. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy inventory and other equipment for his business. He said it will be a very important step for his family. He is a hardworking, diligent and reasonable man.

loans.use: to buy inventory and other equipment to start his own tire repair business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his dairy shop. To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a new cooler, milk and preservatives, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and improve his income. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger diary shop. Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a new cooler, milk, and preservatives.

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en: Beverlyn has a food business. She is 34 years old, a mother of two kids, residing at Maningcol, Ozamiz. She requested a loan  for additional capital to buy raw ingredients like peanuts, sugar and oil for her homemade peanut butter. She has been in this business for almost two years. She deeply wishes to expand her business and put up her own stall to display her products.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like peanuts, sugar and oil for snack vending

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 49 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married with three children.

Bernadeth engages in okay okay (used clothing) vending and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to add to her capital to purchase additional clothing products to sell.

Bernadeth has been a member of PMPC for two years and one month. In the future, she hopes to improve her livelihood in order to give more services to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing products to sell

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy fertilizer and farm supplies for her business. Her earnings were a big help with personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her meet the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florencia dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Viza, una comunidad de clima variado, abundante vegetación, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto variedad catimor, se dedica a esta actividad de tres años, también se dedica al cultivo de maíz amarillo criollo, tiene una familia unida que le apoya en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hermes is 35 years old, he lives with his wife and children in Caserío de Viza, a community with a varied climate and abundant vegetation. It is a rural area of the Santo Tomás district, its population makes a living in agriculture, business and livestock. Situated in the Cutervo province that belongs to the Cajamarca region and northern mountain range of Peru.

He makes a living in agriculture, especially the cultivation of Catimor coffee trees and he has been doing this job for 3 years. He also makes a living in the cultivation of yellow Indian corn. He has a closely knit family that supports him in the work he does. He has asked for a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency) to buy fertilizer to maintain the coffee crop and in this way, to offer his customers timely production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Fe is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a fifty-year-old woman who used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She sells food in a restaurant and began the business in 2009 to earn a living and educate her children. The general public are her major clients. Like any loving parent she wants a loan to pay school fees for her children. She is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en: Tadeo, a 59-year-old resident of Fort Portal is widowed with seven children. He runs a business of raising livestock and beekeeping, which he has been doing since 1998. He started the business in order to generate income for the family .Tadeo dreams of having his children educated and says the high costs of operations affect the business. Tadeo is asking for a loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Elvis Yovani

texts.es:
Elvis de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 3 años y 6 años, uno de ellos está cursando primer grado en la escuela de la comunidad. Elvis  está acompañado, quien se realiza los oficios domésticos.

Elvis tiene cinco años de trabajar como vigilante, pero a la agricultura se ha dedicado desde pequeño es una labor que aprendió de su padre, el lugar donde cultiva está a una distancia de 20 minutos caminando, esta labor la realiza en sus días libres de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.

El dinero lo utilizara para cancelar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara maíz,  asegurando así la alimentación para su familia. 


Sus planes a futuro es darles un buen ejemplo a sus hijos y asegurarle los estudios universitarios, además de seguir cultivando maíz para tener seguridad alimentaria.
texts.en:
Elvis, 32, left school in third grade.  He is the father of two children between the ages of three and six.  One of them is in first grade at the local school.  Elvis is married and his wife manages the house.

Elvis has been working as a security guard for five years, but he has worked in agriculture since he was a child.  He learned farming from his father.  The place where he farms is a 20 minute walk away, and he works there on his days off from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

He will use the money to pay the rent for the land where he will grow corn, ensuring that his family will have food.

Elvis's plans for the future are to set a good example for his children, ensuring that they get a university education, as well as continuing to grow corn as a means to food security.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the land where he will grow corn

loans.name: Züleyha

texts.en:
Züleyha has three children.  She was raised by her aunt after losing her mother and began working at a young age.  For this reason she was married underage and spent her childhood with children.  She did tailoring at home for 32 years.  Two and a half years ago she began working in a tailoring shop.  She sews all kinds of bedding, coverlets, trousseaus and clothing products.  With this loan she will prepare for the summer season with the goal of increasing her sales.  She wants to spend her retirement in better circumstances. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Züleyha Hanım’ın 3 çocuğu var.  Çalışma hayatına çok erken yaşlarda başlayan Züleyha Hanım’ı halası büyüttü. Annesini çok erken yaşta kaybetti.  Bu yüzden çocuk yaşta evlendi.  Çocuklarıyla çocukluğunu yaşadı.  32 yıl evde terzilik yaptı .  2.5 senedir terzi dükkanında çalışma hayatını sürdürüyor.  Her türlü nevresim, pike, çeyiz, giyim ürünleri dikmekte.  Bu kredi ile yaz sezonuna dair hazırlanıp satışlarını artırmayı hedefliyor. Emekliliğini daha iyi şartlarda yaşamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a married woman and she has seven school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Njira has operated a fruits and vegetables stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable vendors in her business.
 
With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 42 year old, single parent who has five children. She sells groundnuts, maize flour, beans, and rice to the general public. She started up a drug shop to enable her to generate extra income. She would like a loan to buy maize flour and groundnuts to sell. Alice hopes to educate her children despite her challenge of price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy maize flour and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a new client to the institution. She is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She has been operating a drug shop for four years, It has been her major source of income. Her major challenge is limited capital which affects her operations. Scovia decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance to expand her drug shop and serve more clients and earn more income. She took a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to expand her business and she appreciates Ugafode for the financial assistance which has improved people’s standards of living.

loans.use: to buy drugs for her shop.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is an old client of the organisation. He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX. He is a  52-year-old man who is married and blessed with one child. He hails from Nyaruzinga village, Ndorero ward, Southern division, Rukungiri municipality.

He operates a cattle fattening business which he has done for over 20 years. He also operates a hotel business in Nyaruzinga trading centre. His major challenge however has been limited capital. However he believes that with the financial boost he will make good returns. His dream is to expand his businesses to greater heights and with this loan from UGAFODE, Raphael is hopeful his businesses are going to expand.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 22-year-old single young man. Iman has a secondary school education. Because of the miserable condition of his family, he could not complete his studies. He was employed with his secondary school certificate as a soldier in the Yemeni army three years ago. His salary was very small and from this salary, he accumulated a good amount of money and opened a small grocery in his area. His neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind and hardworking man.

 As the source of income for his family, Iman has sold groceries and food products since 2012. He started this business with a small capital. Thanks to Iman hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed him to expand his sales volume. For the purpose of further developing in his business, Iman turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER to buy wholesale food items for future retail. 

Iman plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business through opening other branches beside the first one.

loans.use: to buy wholesale food items for his grocery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase household goods in order to trade in organic dairy products.

loans.name: Amosi

texts.en:
Amosi is 44 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Amosi has been working hard to manage his farming. He sells milk and calves. 

To help expand his business, Amosi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UBX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to construct a wider crawl space and buy more calves, and will help Amosi to generate greater profits. Amosi hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his farm sales. 

Amosi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amosi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to construct a wider crawl space and buy more calves.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 71 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo quien es mayor de edad y le apoya con la economía del hogar. Victoria se gana la vida por medio de la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Victoria  desea instalar el servicio de energía eléctrica dado que no cuenta con el servicio y desea poder contar con mejores condiciones de desarrollo. Esta es la razón por la que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Victoria is 71 and lives in her own house along with her grown-up son who helps her support the household.  Victoria has made her living providing domestic services for a long time.  She wants to install electricity since she doesn't have this service and she wants to have better conditions of development.  This is why she requests this loan from FUSAI to spend on installing electricity in her home.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Robert has been working hard to manage his charcoal selling business. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more charcoal, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and add profits. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: stock more charcoal

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga, 43 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost seventeen years, earning a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their food expenses and electric bills. 

Due to insufficient capital she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 16,000 to purchase beverages, coffee, shampoo, cooking oil, soaps, and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, coffee, shampoo, cooking oil, soaps, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is married with three children. She is 38 years old and lives in Baybay Maningcol, Ozamiz City. Linda runs a sari-sari store to earn a living. Each month, she earns a meagre income of PHP 6,000. She has requested a loan to purchase a second-hand motor unit. Linda believes that this will augment their income with transport services. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motor unit.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is widowed with 6 children who are all married. Leonora is 64 years old and lives in Cabunga-an Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested for a loan to buy farm inputs and pesticides.

Leonora has been a member of PMPC for almost 5 years. In the future, Leonora hope to have more savings for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pesticides.

loans.name: Yunila

texts.en:
Yunila is 30 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are now of school age. 

Yunila has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products earning approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Yunila has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future Yunila hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, one of whom is still at school. 
Alicia has had a little store for three years, selling groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell. 
Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca previously took out an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She also has a water distribution business to earn additional income. She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional mineral water needed for her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. The more items for sale will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She also has a tailoring business. Rebecca hopes that her business will last longer and dreams of making a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional mineral water needed for her business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Miriam con su credikiva pasado, pues con él, logró comprar mercancías que pidió a otras ciudades,  le fue de gran utilidad porque las vendió y ganó mucho mas  al realizar compras al por mayor, que  le resultaron rentables, por los precios que adquirió. Desde que recibió su credikiva ha vivido mas tranquila con la utilidad de su negocio. Ella dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias por la ayuda que me ha permitido mantener mi negocio “. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará prendas de acero para venderlas pues son muy escasas en la ciudad y ella tiene su mercado de clientes a quien venderles sobre pedidos y esto es  lo que hace que su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Miriam with her previous Kiva loan.  With it she was able to order merchandise from other cities which was a big help to her because she sold it and made a lot more money.  Buying in bulk was profitable because of the prices she got.  Since receiving her Kiva loan she feels more relaxed because her business is profitable.  She says to her lenders, "Thank you for your help which has allowed me to maintain my business".  Miriam is now applying for a Kiva loan which she will use to buy steel jewelry to sell since it is scarce in her city and she has her market of customers to sell it to in addition to orders.  This is what makes her Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy steel jewelry

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline, aged 38, lives in Hoima Uganda. She is married and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of two school-going children. She has a boutique and sells phone accessories. She desires to educate her children and expand her business only to be limited by inadequate capital and competition. Jackline is acquiring a loan to buy more phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a business lady. She is married and has three children. She runs a catering business and yearns to diversify her business and be able to provide as many solutions to the community as possible. Naomi recently learnt about the Fresh Life Franchise during an event and thought it would be a good business to venture into. 

Naomi's main drive has been wanting to provide better sanitation services through her franchise and improve the quality of lifestyle for the community. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. The money earned from the franchise will be used to repay her loan and add to her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Tukwatanize Kyabayanja Group

texts.en:
Stella, aged 34, lives in Hoima Uganda. She is married and charged with a responsibility of taking care of four school-going  children. She deals in produce, mainly maize and beans, and earns additional income from selling second-hand clothes. She desires to educate her children, buy more land, and build good houses for renting.

Limited capital and competition hinder her business. She is acquiring a loan to buy produce like maize and second-hand clothes to sell.

She is a member of Kyabayanja Tukwatanize where members guarantee each other to access credit. The photo has more than 17 members because they all belong to the group and guarantee each other, whether taking a loan or not.

loans.use: buy produce like maize and second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Musharam

texts.ru:
Мушарам приветливая, общительная, дружелюбная, честная и целеустремленная женщина в возрасте 56 лет. Мушарам имеет 2 детей. Мушарам живет в сельской местности и с юных лет занимается животноводством. У Мушарам нет образования и поэтому всю свою жизнь она занимается разведением скота. Муж Мушарам работает в дехканском хозяйстве и деньги которые он зарабатывает уходят на семейные нужды и зачастую этих денег не хватает на месяц. Муж Мушарам в свободное от работы время помогает жене в разведении скота , так как разведение скота это основная часть их семейного дохода. Мушарам ухаживает за скотом , а муж занимается куплей продажей скота. Мушарам и ее муж работают не покладая рук, чтобы дать своему ребенку достойное образование и обеспечить свои потребности.
 Мушарам берет кредит чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес. Мушарам очень благодарна таким организациям как ООО МДО "АРВАНД" за предоставленную финансовую помощь и поддержку людей со средним и низким уровнем жизни.
texts.en:
Musharam is a lively, friendly, sociable, honest and determined woman. She is 56 and has two children. She lives in a rural area and has raised livestock since childhood. She has no education and has therefore spent her whole life raising livestock. Her husband works at a local farm to earn money for the family but it is often not enough for the month. He helps her with the cattle when he is not at work, as this provides a large part of their family income. Her husband and buys and sells cattle and Musharam cares for them. They both work tirelessly to give their children a decent education and to meet their needs.

Musharam is taking out a loan to buy more cattle to expand their business. She is very grateful to organizations like MDO Arvand, LLC for their financial assistance and support for people with a middle or low standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Baka

texts.en: Baka is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbala region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Baka has been working hard to manage his produce business. To help expand his business, Baka has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Baka to generate greater profits and boost his business. Baka hopes that in the future he will be able to generate more profits. Baka is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Baka who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke, in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past five years, Geofrey has been working hard to manage his business of selling produce. 

To help expand his business, Geofrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Geofrey to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Geofrey hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business. 

Geofrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Geofrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with seven children. She is 69 years old and lives in Baybay Maningcol, Ozamiz City.

Virginia runs a sari-sari (general store) to earn a living and has had this business for 21 years. Each month, she earns 45,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, in order to restock her store with basic commodities, such as sacks of rice, canned goods and laundry soap.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Virginia hopes to have a small carinderia (a local eatery).

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, John has been working hard to manage his hardware, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts, and will help John to generate greater profits and increase on profits. John hopes that in the future he will be able to expand on the business. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more spare parts

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is married with three children. Josie is 45 years old and lives at Gotocan Diot,Ozamiz City. To earn a living, Josie has bee a firewood retailer. She has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 7,000. 

In need of capitalization, she reached PMPC for a loan to purchase corn seeds and seed bed for corn production.  Josie has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Josie hopes to improved and can save money.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and seed bed for corn production

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with five children, three of whom attend school. He has a transport business (boda boda) and earns additional income from a retail shop. He started his business to improve the family's earnings and to become self employed. He hopes to finish constructing his home. Inadequate capital hinders his business as well as threats by thieves.

Fred is acquiring a loan to construct his house.

loans.use: to construct his house.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es:
